You encourage the advances made by §Y[satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n

I've arranged a run-in with [From.GetTitledFirstName] on the palisades of [From.GetHerHis] [From.GetCapitalHolding] today. [From.GetHerHisCap] face lights up upon seeing me and we stay out talking for hours. I offer [From.GetHerHim] a protection spell, in a leather pouch – of course, I do not explain the content... Yet [From.GetSheHe] smiles, accepting the token.

I've arranged a run-in with [From.GetTitledFirstName] on the palisades of [From.GetHerHis] [From.GetCapitalHolding] today. [From.GetHerHisCap] face darkens when I again attempt to discuss my world views. I then offer [From.GetHerHim] my favorite protection spell, a chicken leg in a leather pouch – I thought it was harmless enough, but [From.GetSheHe] refuses to accept the gift.
[From.GetSheHeCap] just needs one more little push.

It's been interesting, but I don't think [From.GetSheHe] is ready for more.

What if I told you that all you have been taught to believe in is a lie? [satanists_recruiter.GetFirstName] continues, throwing a cautious glance around us before pulling up [satanists_recruiter.GetHerHis] sleeve, revealing a scar in the shape of a pentagram. "[Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] lied to Adam in the Garden of Eden. Reject the Tyrant deity and let [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] guide your steps..."

When I revealed the brand on my lower arm, expecting the final hook to sink in, [From.GetFirstName] staggered backwards in shock and made a hand gesture for protection. If I can't turn [From.GetHerHim], no one can.

When I proceeded to reveal the brand on my lower arm, certain that the final hook would sink in, [From.GetFirstName] inhaled sharply, worrying me for a second. If there is any chance it'll [Root.GetDWReasonToJoin], I will.
§Y[satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName]§! leaves you alone for now – the coven will be in contact with you.\n

It has been some time since [satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] was in contact with me. I have been mulling over [satanists_recruiter.GetPossPronoun] words. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] told Adam he would die if he ate of the forbidden fruit... [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] lied. It has been some time since [satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] was in contact with me. I have been pondering what [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] would think of me for venturing down this path, but [satanists_recruiter.GetFirstName] has already offered me more support than [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] ever has. I can't believe I have been so gullible.
I am beginning to feel that I have been missing out...

I found some cryptic scrawlings written in blood on my bedroom door this morning. The guards say they haven't seen anyone enter during the night and I dare not ask my [Root.GetMyLordSpiritualName] to decipher it. Yet, I think I understand... You cut your into your arm, a star surrounded by a circle, a symbol from your forbidden studies.
My immortal soul... What if I'm wrong?
You order your servants to scrub the door clean, putting to rest any rumors this could stir up.\n

[Root.GetSisterBrotherCap] [Root.GetFirstName],
We have received word of your dedication and desire to join the legion of the True Lord. Await the messenger.

Let the Dark One guide you.

I've met an intriguing and hypnotically beautiful [From.GetManWoman] at court. Apparently, this [From.GetFirstName] is a foreign diplomat? I engaged [From.GetHerHim] in conversation for the first time today, and we spoke at length about [Root.GetEducationalTopicPlural]. The [satanists_inductor.GetSocietyRank] smiles. "I'm pleased to find you not only a charming [Root.GetManWoman], [Root.GetFirstName], but also one capable of intellectual discourse. The brethren value the pursuit of knowledge, you see, in addition to more... earthly pursuits." [satanists_inductor.GetFirstName] escorts me to my bedchamber. I hesitate upon entering, finding it flooded with light, as candles form a circle around my bed. Several hooded figures surround the room, chanting in unison. "Fear not, [Root.GetSisterBrother]. Power and pleasure – these are the gifts of [satanists_inductor.GetDWDevil]."

When I wake up the cloaked figures are gone and [satanists_inductor.GetFirstName] is lying next to me, a smile tugging at the corner of [satanists_inductor.GetHerHis] mouth. "Welcome to [satanists_inductor.Society.GetName],  [Root.GetTitledFirstName]", [satanists_inductor.GetSheHe] says. I let go of [satanists_inductor.GetFirstName]'s hand and [satanists_inductor.GetHerHis] smile vanishes. "What are you doing?", the beautiful creature asks. With some help from some of your most loyal guards §Y[satanists_inductor.Society.GetName]§! are discretely escorted away from your [Root.GetCapitalHolding]. "Lost travelers", you explain.\n

My eyes dart wildly around the ungodly scene. The [satanists_inductor.GetSocietyRank] [satanists_inductor.GetFirstName] looks disappointed. My body finally unfreezes and I bolt for the door. "Brothers and sisters, follow [Root.GetHerHim]! [Root.GetFirstName], we can talk about this!" The voice echoes behind me, as I run away. My eyes dart wildly around the ungodly scene. The evil [satanists_inductor.GetSeductressSeducer] rolls [satanists_inductor.GetHerHis] eyes as I bolt for the door. [satanists_inductor.Society.GetNameCap] escape from your [Root.GetCapitalHolding] and you are tragically killed during the chaos.\n

Praise be to Allah!
Signed, Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]

I know [child_offer.GetFirstName] will serve faithfully.

The Order shall have a stronghold in [castle_offer.GetName].
I refuse!
Do not to pay back the money you owe. Beware – the Grand Master will not take your refusal lightly.\n

As the last servant makes their exit, I am finally alone. It has been a long, draining day. Longing for a few carefree moments, I reach for my cup and raise it to my mouth. Wait a moment... what is that smell? There is a faint, bitter note, almost fully disguised by the rich aroma of your drink...

Tired after a long day's work, I absentmindedly raise the cup to my mouth and drain it in one big swallow. I sigh with relief, savoring this one carefree moment. Then I notice the bitter aftertaste on my tongue...
P... poison?!
You search your chambers for clues...\n
You suddenly feel violently ill...\n

It only takes me a moment to find it – on the tray from which I grabbed the cup is a sealed letter. I know that symbol. With shaking hands, I tear it open. "This is not your last day, [Root.GetFirstName]. Our patience, however, is not endless. We will claim that which we are owed. The money or your life – that is up to you."
I cannot risk the fury of the Assassins.
You pay back the money you owe.\n
A vulgar ploy! I do not fold so easily.
You refuse to pay back the money you owe.\n

Recruit to the Assassins
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is sympathetic to the cause of the order. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become an Assassin.
Has not been approached by the Assassins previously.

Most guests have departed and evening has turned into early morning, yet [assassins_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] and I are still deep in conversation. We are talking about religion, righteousness, how to do the right thing. [assassins_recruiter.GetFirstName] suggests that giving alms and fasting must surely bring mortals closer to the divine.

Most guests have departed and evening has turned into early morning, yet I [assassins_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] and are still deep in conversation. We are discussing a hadith [assassins_recruiter.GetFirstName] just read. [assassins_recruiter.GetSheHeCap] suggest that its narrator, Abu Hurairah, might be unreliable and asks if the hadiths recorded by Ali are not preferable.
Those are noble actions, indeed.
Perhaps you are right. I tend to find more value in Ali's words.
Like the Muslim infidels? Never!
[assassins_recruiter.GetFirstName], you sound like a mindless Shiite!
Agreed With Opinion
Disagreed With Opinion

I approached [From.GetTitledFirstName] during a feast last night, intending to figure out whether [From.GetSheHe] might be persuaded to convert to the true faith. We had a long, deep conversation and it seems like [From.GetFirstName] is of sound opinions!

Last night I approached [From.GetTitledFirstName] during a feast, intending to figure out whether [From.GetSheHe] might be persuaded to convert to the true faith. Unfortunately, as soon I steered the conversation towards the topics of the Prophet and his rightful heir, Ali, the narrow-minded [From.GetManWoman] became quite disagreeable...
A good start. I shall continue my enquiries.
Continue in your attempt to recruit §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! to the Assassins.
This is not enough. Proceeding would be too great a risk.
Me, a "[GetFromRootInsult]"? That [GetRootFromInsult] is one to talk!
End your attempt to recruit §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! to the Assassins.

Since I had such a good time a few weeks back, I invited [assassins_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] to share an informal meal. Yet again the conversation found its way to the topic of religion and righteousness. [assassins_recruiter.GetSheHeCap] expressed [assassins_recruiter.GetHerHis] admiration for those willing to give their life fighting for their beliefs.

Most guests have departed and evening has turned into early morning, yet [assassins_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] and I are still deep in conversation. We are talking about religion, righteousness, how to do the right thing. [assassins_recruiter.GetSheHeCap] expresses [assassins_recruiter.GetHerHis] admiration for those willing to give their life fighting for their beliefs.
I agree, [assassins_recruiter.GetFirstName]. If only I could be more like them.
I have little regard for fanatics!
Honorable
Lacks Conviction

I was just about to draft an invitation when [From.GetTitledFirstName] invited me to dine with [From.GetHerHim]. We talked for many hours, even as the plates were emptied and the cups drained. As I praised those willing to die for their faith, [From.GetFirstName] agreed wholeheartedly, wishing [From.GetSheHe] could be more like them.

I was just about to draft an invitation when [From.GetTitledFirstName] invited you to dine with [From.GetHerHim]. The conversation flowed easily and [From.GetFirstName] expressed many admirable sentiments. However, when I mentioned those willing to die for their beliefs, [From.GetSheHe] sneered and condemned "such fanatics".
I think the time has come to ask the question.
Invite §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! to join the Assassins.
Although I fear [From.GetFirstName] is unwilling to fight, [From.GetHerselfHimself].
Fanatics? [From.GetFirstName] is blind to the righteousness of our ways!

We are quiet for a moment, both seemingly contemplating these devoted souls. Then [From.GetFirstName] looks up at me, a curious intensity in [From.GetHerHis] gaze. "That is not an impossible wish, [Root.GetFirstName]. Are you ready to kill and, if He wills it, get killed to defend the words of His Prophet and the rightful heir?"
I am, [From.GetFirstName]. And you say there is a way?
Ask §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! what you can do to serve a greater cause.
What nonsense are you speaking, [From.GetFirstName]?
Dismiss §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! question and end the dinner.

When I suggested there is a way for [From.GetTitledFirstName] to serve the greater good, [From.GetSheHe] only scoffed dismissively and changed the subject. Judging by the look [From.GetSheHe] gave me as I left, however, it seems as if [From.GetFirstName] is not so oblivious after all...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is all grand words but lacks true courage. Disappointing.

When I suggested there is a way for [From.GetTitledFirstName] to serve the greater good, [From.GetHerHis] eyes lit up with a glimmer of hope. "I am ready, [Root.GetFirstName]. Please, if it is true, will you set me on this path?"
Someone will get in touch with you shortly, [From.GetFirstName].
Write a letter to the order about §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! induction. [assassins_inductor.GetSocietyRank] §Y[assassins_inductor.GetFirstName]§! will handle it from here.

I do, [Root.GetFirstName], says [From.GetTitledFirstName] with a solemn, almost ceremonial, voice. "There is an Order devoted to Allah and the rightful Caliph. One that defends those true of faith and bring vengeance to their persecutors. The Assassins are always in need of champions. Think it over, and someone might reach out..."
Me, an Assassin? Perhaps this is my destiny...
Think things over while you wait for someone to get in touch.

My eyes open, seeing only darkness. For a moment, my mind is blank, before the first thoughts get through the haze of sleep. Why did I wake up? A deep [Root.GetManWoman]'s voice cuts through the silence, startling me. "The time has come for you to profess your devoutness to Allah and the rightful imam Ali."
Allahu akbar! Glory to Ali!
Declare your devoutness to Allah and Ali.
I will shout their names from the rooftops! Allahu akbar!
Openly convert to Shia Islam.\n
I will carry out Allah's wishes in secret, no matter the risk.
Secretly convert to Shia Islam. You may openly covert at a later time.\n
I... I'm not sure I have what it takes.
Do not declare your devoutness.

Excellent. I turn my head towards the voice. A hooded figure steps out of the shadows by the [Root.GetChamberOpening] and a hand appears from underneath the cloak, holding out a piece of parchment. "Before we continue, you must sign this. A written pledge of allegiance to the Grand Master of the Assassins. A routine... safety measure."
Of course. One moment, let me find a quill...
Sign the pledge of allegiance.
But this could be used against me!
Refuse to sign the pledge of allegiance.

As soon as I lift the tip of the quill from the parchment the hooded [Root.GetManWoman] snatches it from the desk. "The Grand Master will be pleased, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. You will receive an invitation to our stronghold, but for now, go back to bed. You will need the rest." The next moment, [Root.GetSheHe] is gone.
Farewell... I suppose.
Now all you can do is wait.

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
You are hereby invited to the Assassins stronghold in [inductor_rendezvous.County.GetName]. Arrive at the [inductor_rendezvous.GetHolding] of [inductor_rendezvous.GetName] in a fortnight's time. One of our people will collect you there. Until then, keep safe, and breath not a word of this meeting to any living soul.

Praise be to Allah!
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I shall be there.
Prepare for your journey to §Y[inductor_rendezvous.GetName]§!.

The journey to [inductor_rendezvous.GetName] was comfortable, however, the dwindling mountain path to the Assassins' stronghold was a torment to tread. As I finally arrive at the castle, my guide brings me to the main tower, where I am introduced to [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName].
I am ready to serve, [From.GetSocietyRank].

There is no time for pleasantries, not even a moment to catch my breath, before [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] leads me through another door, down a spiraling stone staircase. We descend in silence. The stair ends and the [From.GetSocietyRank] opens another door, revealing a gloomy basement room and a figure kneeling on the floor.
Who... who is that?

This, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] says solemnly as I enter, "is your test". With these words, [From.GetSheHe] pulls the hood from the [assassins_sacrifice.GetManWoman]'s head. It is [assassins_sacrifice.GetTitledFirstName], my [assassins_sacrifice.GetRootRelation]! The shock in [assassins_sacrifice.GetHerHis] eyes must be mirroring my own. "This [assassins_sacrifice.GetManWoman] is an enemy of our faith. End [assassins_sacrifice.GetHerHim]." The [From.GetSocietyRank] offers me a dagger.

This, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] says solemnly as I enter, "is your test". With these words, [From.GetSheHe] pulls the hood from the [Root.GetManWoman]'s head. It is one of my servants! The chock in [Root.GetHerHis] eyes must be mirroring my own. "This [Root.GetManWoman] is an enemy of our faith. End [Root.GetHerHim]." The [From.GetSocietyRank] offers me a dagger.
If it is the Grand Master's wish.
You kill the servant.
I... I can't do this!
You refuse and try to escape.\n
I beg of you, let us go. I can pay you, I swear.
Attempt to bribe §Y[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]§! into letting you and your intended victim go.\n

The blood is still gushing from the infidel's limp body as I kneel in front of the [From.GetSocietyRank]. [From.GetSheHeCap] recites the oath of the Assassins and I repeat after [From.GetHerHim]. As [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] speaks the final words, inducting me into the order, [From.GetSheHe] smears the blood across my cheeks. "Stand up, Adherent [Root.GetFirstName]. Welcome to the Assassins."
My life for Allah! Praised be the Assassins!

There is no time to think. As I accept the dagger from [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] I sink it into [From.GetHerHis] stomach. I free my intended victim and drag [assassins_sacrifice.GetHerHim] after me, up the stairs, without looking back once. You just keep running. By some miracle, no one intervenes.
We might be safe for now, but for how long?
You manage to escape from the assassins.\n

I turn around and run. [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]'s footsteps get closer behind me and as I reach the top of the stairs, [From.GetSheHe] grips a fistful of my mantle, pulling you down on top of [From.GetHerHis]. Vertigo. Crippling pain. Blind, manic frenzy. By some miracle, you manage to free yourself. You are alive. But for how much longer?
They are... they are coming for me.

There is no time to think. As I accept the dagger from [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] I stab at [From.GetHerHim], without a moment's hesitation. The blade strikes only air. [From.GetSheHeCap] moves too quickly. I am on the floor, trapped under the weight of [From.GetHerHis] body. I plead for my life as [From.GetSheHe] wrestles the weapon from my hand.
I... I panicked! Please! You... you have to believe me!

The look on [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]'s face is pure disappointment. "We had high hopes for you, [Root.GetFirstName], although it seems we were mistaken." I swallow. Loudly. "This cowardice makes you useless to us. Your gold, on the other hand..." As I leave, my intended victim in tow, my hands will not stop shaking.
You... you have my gratitude.

You have no idea what happened as you wake up on the floor of your [Root.GetChamber], a taste of blood in your mouth and a pounding ache along the side of your face. Slowly, the memories come back. A hooded [Root.GetManWoman]... The Assassins. Perhaps you should consider yourself lucky, getting away with only a black eye.
A life of secrecy might not be for me, after all.

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

The recruit you sent us, [assassins_recruitee.GetTitledFirstName], has now completed [assassins_recruitee.GetHerHis] induction into the order. I thank you for this contribution – it will not be forgotten.

Praise be to Allah!
Signed, Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

The recruit you sent us, [assassins_recruitee.GetTitledFirstName], proved to be disaster. We have spent significant resources in our attempt to induct [assassins_recruitee.GetHerHim], all for naught. This lack of judgment will be remembered.

Signed, Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]
My From's face is [From.GetFaceDescription], my relation_target's face is [relation_target.GetFaceDescription], my face is [Root.GetFaceDescription]

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

I call upon you to defend the true faith. The vile infidel [assassins_target.GetTitledName] is waging war against [shiite_defender.GetTitledFirstName]. It is your duty to end [assassins_target.GetTitledFirstName] and [assassins_target.GetHerHis] intolerable aggressions. Turn [assassins_target.GetHerHim] into an example to fill our enemies' hearts with dread.

We have identified [assassins_target.GetTitledFirstName] as one of his key vassals. As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

Yet again our faith is threatened. The infidel [assassins_aggressor.GetTitledName] is waging war against [shiite_defender.GetTitledFirstName]. We have identified [assassins_target.GetTitledFirstName] as one of his key commanders. End [assassins_target.GetHerHim], [Root.GetSocietyRank], and show the [assassins_aggressor.GetTitle] what fate befalls the Assassins' enemies.

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

An unforgivable crime has been committed. The despicable [assassins_target.GetTitledName] has assaulted one of our own. We cannot let such an insult pass unanswered. Make [assassins_target.GetHerHim] suffer, [Root.GetSocietyRank]. [assassins_target.GetHerHisCap] death will make our enemies think twice before they repeat [assassins_target.GetHerHis] mistake.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

I call upon you to take a life in the name of the Order. [assassins_target.GetTitledName] is a wicked [assassins_target.GetManWoman], an enemy of all that which we hold dear. End [assassins_target.GetHerHim], [Root.GetSocietyRank], and make sure [assassins_target.GetSheHe] suffers.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

For far too long, the gentle Shi'a of [shiite_province.GetName] has suffered under the cruel rule of [assassins_target.GetTitledFirstName]. It is your sacred duty to end [assassins_target.GetHerHim] and liberate our people. Turn [assassins_target.GetHerHim] into an example to fill our enemies' hearts with dread.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

As-salaam alaykum, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

Our enemies are growing bolder. They spread their vile heresies, poisoning the minds of our people. This cannot continue. [assassins_target.GetTitledName] is one of the worst offenders, [Root.GetSocietyRank]. Turn [assassins_target.GetHerHim] into an example to fill our enemies' hearts with dread.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Your wish is my command, [From.GetSocietyRank].

I fear I cannot carry out this mission.

died at the hands of the Hashshashin $KILLER$

After having relentlessly studied [plot_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s habits and movements, I finally believe I have found the perfect opportunity for the grand spectacle that will be [plot_target.GetHerHis] death. In a week's time, when [plot_target.GetFirstName] leaves the [plot_target.GetHouseOfWorship] after [plot_target.GetReligiousRite]...

Not even the thick walls of [plot_target.Host.GetTitledFirstName]'s prison can protect [plot_target.GetTitledFirstName] from Allah's judgment. After having spent many nights watching the rotation of the guards and studied the [plot_target.Host.GetCapitalHolding] from every angle, I think I have found my opening...

The craven [plot_target.GetTitledFirstName] has gone into hiding, but no walls or disguises can save [plot_target.GetHerHim] from Allah's wrath. I have identified the servant who brings [plot_target.GetHerHim] messages and last night I followed [Root.GetHerHim] all the way to [plot_target.GetFirstName]'s lair.

The thick [plot_target.Host.Capital.GetHolding] walls of [plot_target.Location.Capital.GetName] might offer [plot_target.GetHerHim] shelter from the epidemic, but the wrath of the Assassins know no such obstacles. After having spent many nights watching the rotation of the guards and studied the [plot_target.Location.GetHolding] from every angle, I think I have found my opening...

There is a solemn, almost reverential, atmosphere as the crowd pours out of the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] after the [Root.GetReligiousRite]. I follow the flow of people absentmindedly while I ponder what the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] said regarding right and wrong, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. Suddenly, I stumble. A moment later something heavy pushes me down into the dirt.

As the cell door creaks I steady myself. [Host.GetTitledFirstName]'s jailer is a brute of a [Host.GetManWoman]. However, when faint light of a distant torch reveals the silhouette in the doorway, my heart sinks from its position in my stomach to the floor. This is not the jailer. And... is that a dagger in [assassin.GetHerHis] hand?

I open my eyes and suddenly I feel wide awake. Something is not right, I can sense it with all my being. Why is the window open...?\nThe whisper emerging from the shadows is soft as silk. "Did you think you could escape the Assassins, [Root.GetFirstName]?"

The atmosphere at court grows more strained each day, so I thought a little feast would do us all good. I am conversing with [conversationalist.GetTitledFirstName] over the main course when the loud clatter of a serving dish crashing to the floor makes me jump out of my seat. I face the clumsy servant but words fail me as I discover the dagger in [assassin.GetHerHis] hand.

It... it is so hard to breathe. A heavy weight is pressing down on me, constricting my chest, pushing the air out of my lungs. As the worlds come in to focus I see a figure hovering over me. Is that a dagger?

I am conversing with [conversationalist.GetTitledFirstName] over the main course when the loud clatter of a serving dish crashing to the floor makes me jump out of my seat. I face the clumsy servant but words fail me as I discover the dagger in [assassin.GetHerHis] hand.
Guards! Help, guards!

I am here to carry out Allah's judgment, [Root.GetFirstName]. The [assassin.GetManWoman]'s voice is deep, tinted with a strange accent. It rises to a loud shout, "[Root.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry]!" The afternoon sun is reflected in the raised dagger, blinding me as [assassin.GetSheHe] stabs downwards.

No one escapes Allah's judgment, or the Assassins. There is nowhere to run. Nothing within reach to use as a weapon. [assassin.GetSheHeCap] points the dagger at me, and says solemnly: "[Root.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [Root.GetFirstName]."

I grasp for the dagger under my pillow, but the shock of this unexpected visit has made my fingers stiff and movement imprecise. Before I can find it, the hooded figure is upon me. A dagger glints in the faint moonlight. "[Root.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [Root.GetFirstName]."

The time has come for the judgment of Allah! The guests fall silent as the [assassin.GetManWoman]'s shout echoes through the hall. A flash of gleaming metal, and then blood, pouring from between my fingers. A soft whisper as the world grows dim: "[Root.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [Root.GetFirstName]."

No one escapes Allah's judgment, or the Assassins. The [assassin.GetManWoman]'s voice is deep, solemn. "[Root.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [Root.GetFirstName]." The moonlight reflects in the dagger as [assassin.GetSheHe] raises it over her head. I close my eyes.
This is the end, then?

It was easy to separate [plot_target.GetFirstName] from [plot_target.GetHerHis] guards. As if [plot_target.GetSheHe] was a sheep, I herded [plot_target.GetHerHim] into the midst of the crowd, where everyone would see. "[plot_target.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry]!" I shouted, raising my dagger. Those who saw will never forget.

Due to my extensive preparations, entering the prison of [plot_target.Host.GetTitledFirstName] was almost too easy. The burly jailer had fallen asleep – one less death tonight, it seemed – but [plot_target.GetFirstName] was wide awake when I entered [plot_target.GetHerHis] cell. "[plot_target.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [plot_target.GetFirstName]."

[plot_target.GetFirstName] woke with a jerk as I slid through the window, scanning the room with a wild look on [plot_target.GetHerHis] face. "[plot_target.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry], [plot_target.GetFirstName]," I whispered and [plot_target.GetHerHis] head snapped towards the shadowy corner where I stood. [plot_target.GetSheHeCap] reached for something – a weapon, perhaps – but [plot_target.GetSheHe] was not nearly quick enough.

Thanks to my servant's disguise I approached [plot_target.GetTitledFirstName] unnoticed. [plot_target.GetHerHisCap] courtiers were loud and jolly, doing their best to forget the misery outside the [plot_target.GetCapitalHolding] walls. As I raised my voice and drew my dagger, however, they all fell silent. "[plot_target.GetAssassinsCrimeOutcry]!"

There, I left my note by a cup, which I laced with a non-lethal dose of poison. It seemed to do the trick – [grand_master.GetSocietyRank] [grand_master.GetFirstName] informed me that the money was returned this morning.

I infiltrated the kitchen staff and bribed a servant to tell me about the [threaten_dear_relation.GetTitledFirstName]'s favorite cake. I brought a slice containing some "secret ingredients" and placed it in [threaten_dear_relation.GetHerHis] [threaten_dear_relation.GetChamber] next to a note directed at [owes_the_assassins.GetTitledFirstName]. It seemed to do the trick – [grand_master.GetSocietyRank] [grand_master.GetFirstName] informed me that the money was returned this morning.

I watched the trade districts of [fire_town.GetName] burn from the safety of a distant hill. How it spread! As the flames danced from building to building, I was convinced the message would get across to [owes_the_assassins.GetTitledFirstName]. Indeed, I was correct – [grand_master.GetSocietyRank] [grand_master.GetFirstName] informed me that the money was returned this morning.

Not a single servant turned their head as I entered the [owes_the_assassins.Host.Capital.GetHolding], not even as I stepped into [owes_the_assassins.GetTitledFirstName]'s [owes_the_assassins.GetChamber]. Normally, this would not unsettle me, but there was something about the tone of [FromFrom.GetHerHis] voice... Veiled or not, a threat is a threat, and this was certainly one.

It seems like my [Root.GetDWDarkMagic] was successful, however, the result was not quite what I imagined. I had hoped the [GetRootFromInsult] [From.GetTitledFirstName] would be stricken by a mysterious case of pox or plague, but as it turns out, my spell only gave [From.GetHerHim] [From.GetDisease].

Praised be [Root.GetDWDevil], my [Root.GetDWDarkMagic] has borne fruit! News has reached me of the [GetRootFromInsult] [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s recent illness. [From.GetSheHeCap] is suffering from [From.GetDisease] and I doubt [From.GetSheHe] will last very long...
At least I hope [From.GetFirstName] suffers!

The concepts of fairness and rules have lost their luster to me. I have lost the Just trait.
Why would all these delicious foods and drinks exist if we were not meant to taste them? I've lost the Temperate trait.

Dark Divorce
Annul your marriage to §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! by death, using dark rituals and magic. This may have repercussions upon your soul!
Though my last act of worship has been some time ago, I can still sense an inhuman touch upon my soul whenever I think about what I did. I have become a changed [Root.GetManWoman].
A tainted soul is but a small price to pay...

As I finish my prayers to [dark_divorce_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] I send for my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName] to join me in my bedchamber. I have hidden objects of worship throughout the room, and under the bed I have discreetly drawn the necessary symbolism. After our union, all that remains to complete the ritual are a few remaining lines of prayer...
Speak the words, and seal [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHis] fate!
Bring the wrath of [dark_divorce_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] upon §Y[dark_divorce_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!!
No... I cannot do this.
Stop the ritual and spare §Y[dark_divorce_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s life. [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHeCap] will be none the wiser.\n

A terrifying scream echoes through the hallways, and when I reach the scene I find a group of my courtiers bending over the lifeless form of my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]. Signs of bodily harm aren't to be found, but the look of sheer terror engraved on [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHis] face is enough to raise the hairs on the back of my neck...
I would rather never see what [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHe] saw.

One moment my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName] is crossing the open from one building to the next, and the next a blindingly bright light and thunderous sound seemingly shatter the world. After myself and the other witnesses manage to recollect ourselves, we find the singed remains of my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife]'s body lifeless on the ground.
Out with a bang! [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHeCap] always did have style.

Screams of panic and agony wake me from my sleep. When I reach my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]'s bedchambers and turn the red-hot doorknob, I find only a few charred bones remaining of my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife]'s body. Aside from the bed [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHe] lay in, the bedchambers were luckily completely untouched by the flames.
Damn! I liked that bed.

As we walk the grounds a rather cheeky crow pecks at my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]'s eyes. One crow grows into many, and before long my guards are fighting a hopeless battle, trying to beat the creatures off of [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHim]. When at length [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHis] screams cease and the cloud of black wings lifts, my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] is but a bloody heap on the ground.
Hmm, a real 'murder' of crows...

My [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName] has begun to speak in tongues and spew obscenities seemingly at random! The courtiers are beginning to believe [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHim] possessed.
This could prove interesting...

My [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]'s deranged ramblings, cackling and screaming turn to a mad cackling laughter that grows louder as [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHe] emerges from [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHis] bedchambers into the open. With what seems like... glee? [dark_divorce_target.GetSheHeCap] looks at her audience and throws herself off the balcony, a dull thud putting an abrupt end to [dark_divorce_target.GetHerHis] crazed laughter.
Ahh, silence is truly golden.
This may have repercussions upon my soul!
This might have repercussions upon my soul!
died from fear
was killed by a lightning strike

As [From.GetTitledFirstName] is bound to the altar [From.GetSheHe] appears to be mumbling prayers through [From.GetHerHis] gag. [From.GetSheHeCap] is sweating profusely, either due to the heat from the nearby pyres or from fear. [From.GetHerHisCap] holy vestments hang in tatters already, exposing [From.GetHerHis] chest. As the appointed hour draws near the chanting of your brethren builds to a crescendo until, finally, it is time.
Plunge my knife into [From.GetHerHis] chest!

Bound and gagged, [From.GetTitledFirstName] is carried out of [From.GetHerHis] cell and dropped into the cauldron. As your acolytes slam down the lid and lock it securely you drop your flaming torch into the firewood stacked around the pot, setting it ablaze. Soon the water within will come to the boil and another soul will be sent to [Root.GetDWDevil].
Good sacrifices are in short supply.

Your acolytes place little [From.GetFirstName] on the altar and fasten [From.GetHerHim] firmly in place. You step forward and [From.GetHerHis] confusion suddenly becomes terror as [From.GetSheHe] sees the knife in your hand. [From.GetHerHisCap] pitiful scream has only just begun before you slit [From.GetHerHis] throat.
[Root.GetDWDevil] prefers innocent souls.

Dressed in a white gown, [From.GetFirstName] screams hysterically as [From.GetSheHe] is bound to the stake emerging from the piled firewood. Frenzied [Root.GetDWMagician]s scream praise to [Root.GetDWDevil] as you approach with your blazing torch held high. At the appointed hour you throw the torch into the oil-soaked wood, the fire roars to life, and suddenly [From.GetFirstName]'s earlier screams seem quiet in comparison.
A virgin for [Root.GetDWDevil]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] looks dazed as [From.GetSheHe] is dragged to the altar, but you can see dawning comprehension on [From.GetHerHis] face as [From.GetSheHe] is tied down. You ignore [From.GetHerHis] begging as chants of praise to [Root.GetDWDevil] build to a crescendo. Finally it is time, you swing your blade in an overhead arc which ends in [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s heart.
Hail [Root.GetDWDevil]!

You struggle against the bonds holding you to the altar, but there is no give in them. As the unholy chanting rises to a frantic crescendo, you see [From.GetTitledFirstName] walking towards you holding a dagger. You redouble your efforts to escape, but [From.GetTitledFirstName] is already raising [From.GetHerHis] dagger over [From.GetHerHis] head in a two-handed grip. You have time to realize the rope around your right hand is starting to loosen just before [From.GetTitledFirstName] blade slams into your heart.
Argh!

Use Hashish from the Assassins
Assassins can use Hashish to experience divine visions to help them in their cause.
Astounding Visions
This character has experienced astounding sights by using hashish provided by the Assassins.
Uplifting Visions
This character has experienced uplifting sights by using hashish provided by the Assassins.
Frightening Visions
This character has experienced frightening sights by using hashish provided by the Assassins.
Hashish Addict
This character is addicted to hashish. They can recover if they abstain from the substance, although this will lead to unpleasant withdrawal symptoms.
Withdrawal Symptoms
This character is suffering from withdrawal from hashish.
I have decided to open my mind to the world with the help of hashish provided to me by the Order. How much should I use?
There is wisdom in moderation.
Be careful in your dosage.
I must strive for balance.
Use the standard dosage.
Truth can only be achieved by the daring.
Use as much as possible.
Like an eagle perched on the cliff overlooking the lands I could see the light that permeates the world and my mind has become clearer than ever.
The visions from the hashish has opened my mind and I feel like I can see the world more clearly now. My place and purpose has been revealed to me and I am more able to do the biddings of the Order.
I woke up this morning in a haystack outside my tower's window. My memories from the day before are hazy, but I remember the sensation of falling through the darkness, surrounded by evil.
The veil has been removed!
I have seen the light.
The night is dark and full of terrors.

It has been weeks since I last used the hashish to open my mind to the world and I find my thoughts return to the experience time and time again. The visions I've seen are hard to shake from my mind and I'm longing to use the drug again.
Just one more time can't hurt.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has become addicted to hashish. [Root.GetSheHeCap] can recover if they abstain from the substance, although this will lead to unpleasant withdrawal symptoms.\n
It has been too long since the last time I used the hashish for the visions and I find myself growing more restless each day. My sleep is becoming erratic and I find it hard to focus.
I need it!
It has been months since the last time I used the hashish and the cravings I previously felt to experience the visions have started to subside.
Praise be Allah!
How could I not feel this hunger inside me before? No wonder the world is as it is when we never realize what is really going on inside our bodies!
Now where did I put that chicken?
By achieving clarity I also see more clearly the threats around me. Traitors to the left of me and infidels to the right. What a fool I have been!
I can't trust anyone.
I wonder, what is the point of it all? Now that I see things so clearly, the illusions that surround us fade away and I realize... There's no point to it.
I think I'll go lie down for a bit.

By Allah, they are everywhere. Hiding in every corner, nook and cranny. Flapping their wings and staring at us, trying to fool us that they are only around at night. I must tell my people what is going on!
We need to move, this is bat country!
Praise be Allah for opening my vision, it is so obvious to me now that [drug_plotter_reveal.GetTitledName] is trying to kill me!
Allah protect me!
Praise be Allah for opening my vision, it is so obvious to me now that [drug_plotter_reveal.GetTitledName] is having designs on my [drug_plotter_reveal.PlotTargetTitle.GetFullName]!
Vultures!

I see now how our world is an intricate web of lies and plots, and it is thanks to the Order that I realized that [drug_plotter_reveal.GetTitledName] is planning to kill [drug_plotter_target.GetTitledName].
Thank Allah that it is not me they're after.

The herbs that the Order has made me realize how we all just desire things like rabid dogs. Like how I now see that [drug_plotter_reveal.GetTitledName] is trying to get [drug_plotter_reveal.GetHerHis] filthy paws on the [drug_plotter_reveal.PlotTargetTitle.GetFullName] belonging to [drug_plotter_target.GetTitledName].
They are like vultures.

It is incredible how you can so easily not see a person close to you. I must have walked past [slacker_buddy.GetFirstName] hundreds of times without noticing him, but thanks to the Order I can now see what a good friend I have nearby!
I tell you, brother!
I sank my eye into [drug_new_lover.GetHerHis]. I caught a glimpse of a deep dawn and saw the ancient yesterday and what I do not know.
I feel the universe flowing between our eyes.

The hashish has finally give me clarity, and now I see the treachery going on all around me. It is clear to me now that my [Root.Spouse.GetHusbandWife] is having a relationship with [drug_cheater_lover.GetFirstName] behind my back!
I will tell everyone!
No, I must be imagining things.

My clothes! They come through the clothes! Subversive forces trying to sway the Righteous from the Path. We must get rid of it, so that They cannot use it, for if we wear them They will be close to the purity of our body.
It is the only way!
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! makes a fool of [Root.GetHerselfHimself] to the court.
The shadows close in from all around making the world seems so dark and frightening. My heart is racing.
I think I'll go lie down.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! dies
died from using too much Hashish

Praise [Root.GetDWDevil] devoted [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]!\n\nAn opportunity to strike at the foolish followers of the false gods has presented itself. Their priests in [dw_desecration_target.GetName] are growing fat and bloated in ignorance of the true state of the world. By tearing down their idols and stealing their wealth we will surely gain the favor of [Root.GetDWDevil].
As [Root.GetDWDevil] bids!
I think there are other things I can do for [Root.GetDWDevil] right now.
My forces has breached the outer defenses of the [dw_desecration_target.GetHolding] in [dw_desecration_target.GetName]. I should prepare myself to enter and do the work of [Root.GetDWDevil].
Praise [Root.GetDWDevil]!
No, there's too many people around.

My preparations and plans have been made, a servant has been bribed to leave a side door to the [dw_desecration_target.GetHolding] in [dw_desecration_target.GetName] open so that I and some faithful servants can enter and do the dark biddings of [Root.GetDWDevil].
It is time.

With a group of handpicked faithful [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] I have entered the hallowed grounds of the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] in [dw_desecration_target.GetName]. However as soon as I step inside the doors a [desecration_holder.Religion.GetPriestTitle] throws himself at our feet begging us in the name of [desecration_holder.Religion.GetHighGodName] to show mercy and swears to not utter a word of our presence.

As I and my cadre of faithful [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] enter the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] of [dw_desecration_target.GetName] I find no-one other than [desecration_holder.GetTitledFirstName] in the main chapel.

As I and a group of my faithful make our way through the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] in [dw_desecration_target.Title.GetName] I spot a [desecration_holder.Religion.GetPriestTitle] tending to their duties in the middle of the night.

As I and a group of my faithful make our way through the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] in [dw_desecration_target.Title.GetName] I spot [desecration_holder.GetTitledFirstName] tending to their duties in the middle of the night.
Seize them. Their blood will be a good sacrifice for [Root.GetDWDevil].
Knock them out from behind, they will make for a good sacrifice.
Kill them, dead men tell no tales.
Let them live, if they speak it shall only serve to spread the glory.
Avoid them, no need for the extra risk.

As my [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] approach the [desecration_holder.Religion.GetPriestTitle] they call out for help and grab a nearby candelabra. Within short notice a small group of priests come rushing into the room and a melee breaks out around me.

As my [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] approach [desecration_holder.GetTitledFirstName] [desecration_holder.GetSheHe] calls out for help and grabs a nearby candelabra. Within short notice a small group of their comrades come rushing into the room and a melee breaks out around us.
To arms! For [Root.GetDWDevil]!
Retreat!

Navigating our way through the small [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] I and my companions have entered the small room that goes for the inner sanctum. The room contains the sparsest possible honorings to [desecration_holder.Religion.GetHighGodName] and a scant few decorative idols and relics. The state of this place shows clearly the superiority of our cause!

Making our way through the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] I and my companions enter the inner sanctum with its relics and religious idols. A small treasure in both the spiritual and material worlds lies before us. Such a rich and holy place will be most fitting for our dark deeds.

Having penetrated the defenses of the impressive [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] I and my companions have entered the inner sanctum and are preparing for the desecration ritual. The walls are covered in rich tapestries and holy relics and idols are strewn across the room. It is undoubtedly a place of both wealth and piety, perfect for our cause!
I will take the most expensive relics for myself!
I will use the most holy in the rites of desecration!
These relics shall be put to better use. My use.
Burn it all in the name of [Root.GetDWDevil]!
As the clamor of battle my faithful and I exit the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship] having completed our ritual of desecration. The holiness of the place will be tainted for years to come.
The night is silent as we exit the [desecration_holder.GetHouseOfWorship], our foul rites making sure that the holiness of the place is tainted for years to come.
[Root.GetDWDevil] will be pleased.
Dark deeds done in secret.
Though I may suffer for now, no earthly ailment is beyond the power of [Root.GetDWDevil]. I am preparing a great ritual to cleanse my body and become like new.
[Root.GetDWDevil] may take, and [Root.GetDWDevil] may give.
As the ritual is being finished I can feel my strength returning to me, purging the weakness that has been holding my body in a vice.
The light! The light! Thank [Root.GetDWDevil], I can see again!
A miracle! My sword has returned to me! If this is not proof of the power of [Root.GetDWDevil] I do not know what is!
What power [Root.GetDWDevil] displays! The pain of regrowth is immense, but I am restored!
The blessings of [Root.GetDWDevil] courses through my veins, and I can already feel the filth of disease being forced from my body!
[Root.GetDWDevil] has found me unworthy. I have been so loyal, so devout, yet I still suffer under these afflictions! Why, oh why, powerful [Root.GetDWDevil]?
I feel the power of [Root.GetDWDevil] course through me, closing wounds and knitting bone back together. I am blessed.
I feel the power of [Root.GetDWDevil] course through me, but it seems that my offering was not enough to cure me completely.
All will be as [Root.GetDWDevil] desires.
By using their dark magic devil worshipers can heal themselves, sometimes from the most grievous injuries.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped package. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the package and opens it to show an ancient long tunic. It is the seamless robe that Jesus himself wore, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a gilded thorn branch. It is a piece of the thorn crown that Jesus was forced to wear at His crucifixion, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small piece of ancient wood within. It is a piece of the True Cross, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small piece of skin immersed in oils within. It is the prepuce of Jesus himself, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains, cut off only days after His birth!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small piece of bone within. It is the finger-bone of a local saint, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them an ornate silver case. Opening the case [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] show an old and gnarled staff, explaining that it is the rod of Moses brother, Aaron, which he used to astound the Egyptians!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them an ornate silver box. In it lies a small seal with a six-pointed star, the renowned Seal of Solomon, said to grant control over demons!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a sheathed sword, carefully wrapped in protective cloth. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the cloth and presents it to me – it is one of the Prophet's own nine swords!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show an old piece of parchment, signed with the Prophet's own seal!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small clipping of black hair. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] explains that it is some of the Prophet's own beard hair.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them an intricately decorated bottle. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] explains that it contains water that has been in contact with one of the buttons of the Blessed Mantle of the Prophet.
[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a folded banner in red, blue and gold, the Derafsh Kaviani, banner of Persia!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a small sapling of Haoma, the holy bush! I must immediately find a place for it in my gardens.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a gnarled thick stick wrapped in smooth cloth. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] explains that it is a branch from the Great Cypress that the prophet Zoroaster planted himself in the ancient times!

Attempt to negatively influence §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s personality, increasing [Root.GetHerHis] opinion of you by §G75§! upon success. Failure might tarnish your reputation, though...\n
Corrupt [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]
Corrupt §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! for material gains and [From.GetDWDevil]'s appreciation. This might have repercussions upon your soul!
§Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has not attempted to corrupt §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! the past §Y10§! years

No person lives a life entirely devoid of sin, and neither does [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]. I just have to find some traits of [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] character that I can build on...
I'll turn [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] guilty pleasures into vices!
Send people to find out whether §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! has any character traits that could develop into vices.\n
I'm sure [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe]'s not quite as virtuous as [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] pretends to be!
Send people to find out whether §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! has any virtues [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] might not whole-heartedly believe in.\n
No, I don't think this is productive.
Give up your attempt at corrupting §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n

My agents have proved their worth! It would appear that [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] has a liking for the pleasures of the flesh. A night of debauchery could well turn [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] secret liking into a publicly-known love. I shall write the invitation...

My agents have uncovered rumors that [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] rather enjoys his feasts. Introducing [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to new, exotic flavors might fuel [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] appetite even further. I shall write the invitation...

Thorough investigation has revealed [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] rather likes [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] gold. I wonder if [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] is a gambling [corrupt_priest_target.GetManWoman]? I shall write the invitation...

It would seem that [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] is somewhat bothered by the hassles of ruling. I could show [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] how much more enjoyable it is to do nothing, instead. I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] apparently has problems coming to terms with [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] not having what [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] neighbor has. Perhaps I can convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] of how right [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] feelings are over a banquet. I shall write the invitation...

My agents met with several of [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s courtiers, who all spoke of barely-suppressed outbursts of anger on the part of their [corrupt_priest_target.GetLordLady]. I should speak with [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] and convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to henceforth let it all out, instead. I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] seems to quite enjoy flattery and praise. I could organize a celebration in [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] honor, affirming [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] has reason to be haughty. I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s court appears to be in a mild state of confusion. [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] seems to have a penchant for telling minor lies and watching the confusion that ensues. I should invite [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] and show [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] how much more rewarding the bigger lies are. I shall write the invitation...

My agents have revealed that [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] is not always equally just in his judgments. If [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] were to visit and judge some of my criminals, I could encourage [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to judge based on appearance and whim. I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s courtiers have learned not to walk too closely by [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] at the top of the staircase. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] seems to quite enjoy them getting hurt. I'm sure [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] would like to see my torture chamber! I shall write the invitation...
...and hope my ploy succeeds.
Attempt to corrupt §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
...and beseech [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] to empower me!
§Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! cannot possibly stand against [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil]!\n
...and coat my words in honey.
Well-chosen words will likely have a better effect on §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
...and use my knowledge of [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.Religion.GetScriptureName] to convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim].
With well-founded arguments §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! will likely see the reason in my words.\n

The raunchy nights of pleasure and debauchery I hosted at my court for [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] seem to have truly freed [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] from [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] remaining inhibitions. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] is most thankful to me for showing [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] needs not be ashamed of pursuing pleasure.

The lavish feast to which I invited [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] have paid off, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] has already started to consume vast quantities of the delicacies I introduced [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to. Before [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] left, [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] made sure I understood how grateful [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] was for the experience.

During our games of chance [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] struggled more and more to hide [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] fondness for the gold coins on the table. With some well-placed words I managed to make [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] come to terms with [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] greed. Letting [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] win most of the games ensured [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] left both thankful and in high spirits.

Over the past few days [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] and I did almost every conceivable thing... except managing a court. I have never seen [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] happier, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] seemed most excited to spend less time ruling and more time enjoying life.

As we feasted I subtly directed the conversation towards [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s neighbor. Through carefully-dropped hints I convinced [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] that [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] does indeed rightfully covet much that is owned by others. The reinforcing effect this had on [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] envy has already become very clear.

I slipped some coins to a servant in return for him bumping into [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] in a hallway during [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] visit. Only a few words from me were needed to unleash [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName]'s anger upon the servant. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] afterwards confessed to me how liberating it was to let out [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] anger, and was most grateful I helped [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to discover this.

Over the course of the celebrations [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s ego inflated like a bloated cow. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] has already become insufferable to be around, but at least [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] was exceedingly grateful that I 'finally recognized [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] greatness'...

As we feasted, I eventually subtly turned the conversation to the small lies [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] uses for [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] amusement. We discussed how [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe], by using [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] talent for lies, could reap far greater rewards than mere 'amusement'. Thoughtfully, [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] agreed, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] was most thankful to me for opening [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] eyes.

With my calm support [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] began to visibly enjoy sentencing people based on, for instance, their appearance, or the first sentence of their defense. A grateful [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] afterwards told me [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] far preferred this over the tedious process of listening to lengthy explanations...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] and I had a lot of fun in the dungeons. The prisoners, not so much. Both [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] and I discovered a new side of [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] that was quite... unsettling. Not that it detracted from his gratitude.

It seems that liberating [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] from [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] virtue has had unforeseen effects... Having finally discovered what [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] has missed out on for all these years, [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] has sunk headlong into utter depravity.
The things I do for [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil]...
[corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] will surely bless me!\n
I am [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil]'s greatest servant!
[corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] will surely bless me greatly!\n

Despite my best efforts, one misplaced word was all that was needed for [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] to take offense from my suggestion. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] stormed out of the room indignantly, and what's far worse, [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] outed my supposed 'wickedness' to everyone!
Oh no...
People will not be happy to hear this...\n

A lingering touch here, slightly too long a glance there... [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] might not be entirely as chaste as [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] pretends to be. I have just the servant for [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] to meet. I shall write the invitation...

Some of [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s servants reportedly saw [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] sneak into the kitchen at night to enjoy some leftovers. If I could speak to [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] in private I am sure I could convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] there is no need for secrecy on these matters. Perhaps [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] would like to visit my court? I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] at times seems almost reluctant to give to others. With a good example [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] could be acquainted with the joys of keeping wealth to yourself. I shall write the invitation...

It's almost as if [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] works hard because [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] has been taught to, and not because [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] believes [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] should. I should show [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] that it is alright not to be a slave to hard work. I shall write the invitation...

Occasionally [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s smiles and gentle words seem rather forced. With some help I am sure [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] could come to understand that one does not always need to be all smiles with everyone. I shall write the invitation...

Regular sighs and long, annoyed pauses give away that [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] isn't as patient as is widely thought. Keeping all that frustration pent up inside cannot be healthy. I shall write the invitation...

At times, when [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] does not receive his due credit, my agents report it almost seems as if [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] is about to speak up. I will show [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] how it feels to be recognized! I shall write the invitation...

Honesty has more than once gotten [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] into trouble. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] should learn how to avoid it by using little white lies. I shall write the invitation...

[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] has allegedly voiced [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] annoyance that being just is so time-consuming. Surely I can make [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] see how cutting a few corners could save [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] a lot of time. I shall write the invitation...
...and hope my ploy succeeds.
Attempt to corrupt §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
...and beseech [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] to empower me!
§Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! cannot possibly stand against [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil]!\n
...and coat my words in honey.
Well-chosen words will likely have a better effect on §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
...and use my knowledge of the [corrupt_priest_spell_caster.Religion.GetScriptureName] to convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim].
With well-founded arguments §Y[corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! will likely see the reason in my words.\n

I saw [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s glances at the servant during our conversation. With a few encouraging words I got them to seclude themselves, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] returned a changed [corrupt_priest_target.GetManWoman]. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] was most pleased with my support!

Having ensured that I caught [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] eating leftovers in the kitchen after our banquet, I managed to soothe [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] worries and convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHim] there was no reason to continue to pretend to have a small appetite. Our next banquet was far more enjoyable...

Using a display of wealth, I managed to convince [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] that sometimes money is of better use in one's own pockets. Thoroughly enticed by the prospect, [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] was most pleased someone had spoken so frankly to him on these matters.

I showed [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] by example that one can achieve things without working hard. [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] truly seemed to enjoy the time spent at my court, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] has already resolved to spend less time working hard when [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] returns home.

The servant I had bribed continued his insolence for hours, before [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s kindness finally broke. We had a good long discussion afterwards, and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] finally understood that some people are simply not deserving of kindness. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] was most thankful to me for opening [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] eyes.

As I heard [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] sigh in frustration at the servant's incompetence, I gave the lad a piece of my mind. Before long, [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName]'s patience ended and [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] joined me in a display of our anger. [corrupt_priest_target.GetFirstName] was incredibly grateful for the release, and seems to have done away with patience since.

All that was needed was to insist on giving [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] the credit that [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] was due. After some half-hearted attempts at avoiding it, [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] finally accepted the praise, and seems to have gotten a taste for recognition now.

A simple demonstration of talking my way out of an embarrassing situation by using a small lie was enough to get [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] interested. With some explanation and reassurance that nobody would get hurt, [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHe] seems to have finally abandoned [corrupt_priest_target.GetHerHis] honesty.

I showed [corrupt_priest_target.GetTitledFirstName] how quickly I judged some of the more bothersome criminals based on my intuition rather than a detailed examination of the facts. [corrupt_priest_target.GetSheHeCap] was most impressed, and has already started following my example!
I am so altruistic!
[corrupt_priest_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] will surely bless me!\n
Corrupt Priest
I will see to it!
Unfortunately I cannot do so at this time.
Demonic Possession
Attempt to possess §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! with a [From.GetDWDemon], making [Root.GetHerHim] fanatically loyal to you. This may have repercussions upon your soul!
Possession of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has not already been attempted\n
I will see to it!
Unfortunately I cannot do so at this time.

In the middle of the night, I seclude myself in the room I have meticulously prepared for tonight's [Root.GetDWDarkMagic]. With every step of the ritual completed, the air in the room grows more and more oppressing, until finally I sense I am about to unleash a being of terrible power upon my unsuspecting foe.
Do it!
Send out the being to take possession of §Y[possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]§!!\n
No, I'll be merciful...
§Y[possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be none the wiser.\n

The ritual was a resounding success! [possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName] seems to have taken quite a liking to me, and is now far more amenable to my suggestions. The unfortunate side effect is that [possess_courtier_target.GetSheHe] has become quite obviously... insane.
Exactly as planned.

Not everything has gone according to plan. Although something quite clearly seems to have taken up residence within [possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName], whatever it is does not seem to be inclined to make [possess_courtier_target.GetFirstName] more loyal towards you...
Curses!
§Y[possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! retains [possess_courtier_target.GetHerHis] free will.\n

The ritual has failed completely. Whether [possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s mind proved too strong, or due to some other reason, the entity did not manage to take a hold of [possess_courtier_target.GetHerHim]. [possess_courtier_target.GetFirstName]'s mind has completely shattered in the process, however.
How... Unfortunate.
§Y[possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! retains their free will, or what remains of it.\n

Despite [possess_courtier_target.GetTitledFirstName]'s frequent bouts of madness, [possess_courtier_target.GetSheHe] has indeed been loyal so far. Which is why it comes as such a surprise to hear [possess_courtier_target.GetHerHis] characteristic cackling laughter behind you as cold steel sinks into your back.
B-but you were so loyal!

[benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName]'s slothfulness has long been known in the Order, subjecting [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHim] to its scorn. I could teach [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHim] to set up a horarium to structure [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHis] time, helping [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHim] to work harder.

Despite having been a part of the Order for a long time, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName] still does not truly exemplify the Benedictine ideals of hard work and structure. I could teach [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHim] to set up a horarium to structure [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHis] time.
I will, but [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHis] first lesson must be that good things do not come for free.
Offer to help [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetTitledFirstName] in return for monetary compensation.\n
No, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSheHe] must find [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHis] own way.
Do not help [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetTitledFirstName].\n

Blessings to you, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName],
Forgive me for writing so candidly, but your unfortunate lack of work ethic is putting our Order in a poor light. I propose to aid you to find structure and purpose in life. A minor form of compensation in return for my help would already go a long way to teaching you the value of hard work.

Signed, [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName]

Blessings to you, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName],
I have observed your attempts at following the Rule of Saint Benedict, and I noticed you could do with some help. Allow me to offer mine. However, the first lesson must be that nothing in life is obtained without cost, and a minor form of compensation would therefore be required.

Signed, [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName]
[benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSheHeCap] is right, I could use the help...
How dare [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSheHe]?!
I don't need [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetHerHis] help.

Blessings to you, [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName],
I thank you for your offer of help, and I send to you the requested payment alongside this message. I look forward to your guidance!

Signed, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName]
Excellent, let us begin...
Help [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetTitledFirstName] to become a hard worker.\n

With patient dedication [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetTitledFirstName] has shown me how to create a horarium to assign my time appropriately, making it easier to structure the work I do. It has already proven to be most useful, and work comes more easily to me now.
[benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName] is a gift from the Lord himself!

With some help and ample amounts of discipline the horarium [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName] helped me create has allowed me to defeat my laziness. Hard work is so much more fulfilling!
[benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName]'s horarium was exactly what I needed to truly live up to the ideals of our Order.
Hard work is its own reward.

[benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName].
I am most offended by your insinuation that I embarrass the Order. I neither need nor desire your aid, and I would not think to pay you for it even if I did. Perhaps you should focus on your own work rather than stick your nose in others' affairs.

Signed, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName]

Blessings to you, [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentor.GetFirstName],
I thank you for your offer of help, but I do not feel that it is necessary at this point.

Signed, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName]
This is... Unfortunate.
Very well.
[benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetTitledFirstName] has rejected my offer of help.

The horarium I helped [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName] create has worked wonders. [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSheHeCap] has bettered [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHis] ways, and now works hard like a true Benedictine!

With the aid of the new horarium I helped [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetHerHim] make, [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName] has become a proper hard worker.
[benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetSisterBrotherCap] [benedictines_diligent_mentee.GetFirstName] is now truly one of us.
Outraged

As I finish my prayers to [dark_divorce_spell_caster.GetDWDevil] I send for my [dark_divorce_target.GetHusbandWife] [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName] to join me in my bedchamber. I have hidden objects of worship throughout the room, and under the bed I have discreetly drawn the necessary symbols. After our union, all that remains to complete the ritual is a few remaining lines of prayer...
