I shall do a pilgrimage to one of the holy sites of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith seeking enlightenment and purification.
I will start making travel plans.
There are many places a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] might visit during a pilgrimage. They will undoubtedly all offer enlightenment but a closer location may make for a safer journey.
I will go to Sarnath, where the Sanga was born.
I will go to Bodh Gaya, where Buddha achieved enlightenment.
I will go to the monasteries of Sanchi.
There are many places a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] might visit during a pilgrimage. They will undoubtedly all offer enlightenment but a closer location may make for a safer journey.
I will go to the white pond of Shravanabelegola.
I will travel to the mountain of Girnar.
I will go to Shikarji, where twenty of the tirthankaras achieved Moksha.
There are many places a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] might visit during a pilgrimage. They will undoubtedly all offer enlightenment but a closer location may make for a safer journey.
I will go to the eternal city of Varanasi to cleanse myself at the ghats.
I will travel to the mountain of Girnar.
I will seek Mathura, the birthplace of Krishna.
My preparations are done and the time has come to begin my pilgrimage to Sarnath. Soon I shall experience the tranquility and enlightenment of the park in which the Buddha held his first lectures.
My Journey Begins!
My preparations are all done and it is now time to begin my pilgrimage for Bodh Gaya and the sacred Bodhi Tree.
My Journey Begins!
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for Monasteries of Sanchi.
My Journey Begins!
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to start my pilgrimage for Shravanabelagola.
My Journey Begins!
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to start my pilgrimage for the ancient mountains of Girnar.
My Journey Begins!
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for the forest of Madhuban and the Shikarji peaks.
My Journey Begins!
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for the land of Braj and the twin cities of Mathura and Vrindavan.
My Journey Begins!

I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for the ancient city of Varanasi. Soon I shall cleanse my body in the Ganges as generations have before me.
My Journey Begins!
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Sarnath.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Bodh Gaya.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Sanchi.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Shikarji.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Shravanabelagola.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Girnar.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Varanasi.
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pilgrimage to Mathura.
It is the season of the monsoon and rain is pouring down. Roads turn to mud and crops wash away. The life of a pilgrim can sometimes be a hard and arduous one.
My faith will keep me strong and safe.
I regret setting out on this adventure.

The dry season is upon us and there is no water in sight. A pilgrim's life can sometimes harsh and unforgiving but it is clear this is taking a heavier toll on the villages I pass by than it does on me.
I must attempt to alleviate their suffering.
Such is life in the dry season.

Any traveller would balk at the prospect of traversing hills and jungle but it was the shorter route. Emerging from the undergrowth however it is becoming increasingly clear that I have made a mistake. The road ahead is not necessarily as dangerous as what now lies behind, but it is quite clearly not the right road.
I knew I shouldn't have trusted those locals!
I should have paid better attention to their instructions.
Let's explore this area and learn more about life in the jungle!

A large group of mounted warriors block our way. The local Raja is a man that has taken it upon himself to relieve pilgrims, merchants or other travelers of some of their wealth in order to allow them passage. Turning back is not an option, either we pay or we will have to fight these men.
Pay them their fee.
We must defend what is ours!

It has been days since we last saw a settlement and deep forests surround us on all sides. The small road we have been following has all but disappeared in the thick undergrowth. As I look up I can make out a huge creature native to this jungle on the other side.
Turn, and run!
I must fight this beast!

Since this journey began I have come to pass through many cities and villages. Few have been as poor as the settlement that now lies before us. Men, women and children live in such poverty that it is hard to see how they can endure, and yet... These are some of the happiest people I have ever come across!
I can learn much from these villagers.
I will teach them about the ways of the real world!

A pilgrimage is as much an inner adventure as it is a journey through the physical realm. As my goal grows ever closer the people I meet and the places I see has made me reflect and re-evaluate things I thought I knew about life.
This is a marvelous opportunity.
It is time to rest.

As we looked for a place to set up camp at the end of a long day we stumbled across a sentry. Having examined our group he decided that we are harmless pilgrims and bid us to enter the camp of his master, a rich vaishya merchant of the southern trade guilds.
I must thank them for their kindness.
They are only giving me what is my right.
Everything seems to taste foul today. Was it the local cuisine or that night spent camping in a swamp? It is hard to say for sure but something is not right with this pilgrim...
A small offering and then I must continue onwards.
It is time to rest and heal.

You come across a thriving city in the middle of a dry upland. The secret of their prosperity seems to be huge water tanks, built and maintained by the local Raja. A separate reservoir is also under construction to allow the city to grow even bigger. You stop to admire this feat of engineering and cannot help wondering how much a similar construction could benefit [Root.Capital.GetName].
I must learn more about these reservoirs.
Such a futile endeavor, rain falls where it wills.

In the middle of a small village stands an unusually large pipal tree. The villagers have built a platform of grass and mud around its center, this is clearly a place for spiritual reflection and discussion.
I must stay and learn what these people can teach me.
I have no time to lose.

After a trek of many days through unfamiliar lands I now stand before an unfamiliar but dazzingly splendid city. Houses of rich and poor alike are made of stone and on the central hilltop a citadel looks out over massive water reservoirs to keep the inhabitants supplied with water at all times.
Let us rest and enjoy city life!
You will make new acquaintances.\n
City life is an unnecessary diversion.

Following an audience with the local Raja you spend the rest of the day exploring the city. Its central position along a major trade route attracts travelers from all over the region. Among the many travelers you meet a [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetManWoman] entirely after your own mind. Your meeting does not last long but as you part your new friend invites you to visit [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetHerHim] in [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetHerHis] native [home_of_new_friend.GetName].

Following an audience with the local Raja you spend the rest of the day exploring the city. Its central position along a major trade route attracts travelers from all over the region. Among the many travelers you unexpectedly meet an old acquaintance from home.  [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetName] is also on the road and you use this opportunity to get to know each other better. You find that [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetSheHe] is a [new_friend_far_away_from_home.GetManWoman] entirely after your own mind and as you part you promise to see each other again in [home_of_new_friend.GetName].
I have made a new friend!

As I entered the city I was quickly invited to the citadel of the local Raja. Entering the audience chamber another visitor storms in demanding to know why I was given this right to enter before [new_enemy_far_away_from_home.GetHerHim]. The Raja manages to calm the situation somewhat but as [new_enemy_far_away_from_home.GetSheHe] leaves [new_enemy_far_away_from_home.GetSheHe] swears that I will pay for this slight.
It would seem I have made a new enemy.

As I entered the city I was quickly invited to the citadel of the local Raja. Entering the audience chamber another visitor storms in demanding to know why I was given this right to enter before [new_enemy_far_away_from_home.GetHerHim]. The Raja manages to calm the situation somewhat but as [new_enemy_far_away_from_home.GetSheHe] leaves he swears that I will pay for this slight.
Spending time and money in a city is a good way to make new acquaintances. I cannot help however this has been a day wasted on my journey.
It is time we continue towards our goal.

It has been months since I left my home behind. I cannot help but wonder how my house and family fares without me. Surely I arranged things as well as possible before I left however, who could I trust if not friends and family?
I am sure everything is fine.
I cannot let go of these thoughts...
Arrival in Sarnath

A short journey from the holy city of Varanasi lies Sarnath. This is the park in which Buddha gave his first sermons, setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion, telling his followers of the four noble truths and founding the Sangha itself. Today the park is home to the imposing Dhamek Stupa and over a thousand priests and monks.\n\nThis is one of the most bustling centers of Buddhist teachings in India and one of the sites named by the Buddha himself as a worthy pilgrimage.
I must seek the middle way.
Bodh Gaya

You have finally arrived in Bodh Gaya, by many considered the seat of Buddhism. It was here that Buddha once sat under the tree of enlightenment, meditating on the mysteries of the universe. Over the centuries rulers and influentials both in India and further away have contributed to a great number of temples, monasteries and shrines at this post. To this day the monks of Bodh Gaya has kept a giant Bodhi Tree alive here, a huge pipal right next to the 'Diamond Throne' that a ruler of another age built to commemorate the event.\n\nAs you approach the blue tiled walls of the massive Mahabodhi temple you reflect on how different this site must be from when Buddha himself came here. At that point he was not unlike yourself, a simple ascetic seeking enlightenment.
I too seek to be enlightened.
Sanchi

You have finally arrived in Sanchi, one of the oldest centers of Buddhist worship in the world. Legend has it the original Stupa here was constructed by Emperor Ashoka at the insistence of his Vidishan queen Devi. Ever since Buddhists have been coming here to seek out the serenely secluded environment, and over hundreds of years more temples, stupas and monasteries have sprung up in this ideal place for monastic life.\n\nAs you approach the elaborate Torana of the ancient Great Stupa of Ashoka you reflect on the generations of faithful that have walked this way before you as well as on the fate of Sariputra and Mahamoggalana whose relics lie within.
As is fitting for a disciple of Buddha.
Shravanabelagola

You have finally arrived in Shravanabelagola, the white pond of the Shravana. For centuries great monks and Sravakas have meditated here on the hills of Chandragiri and Vindhyagiri, among them even great kings and emperors. As you approach the main pond you reflect on the faith of Bahubali whose atonement for his sins and sublimation into godhood is commemorated here by a 57 feet statue in his likeness. Shravanabelagola is the site of many Jain mathas and temples and is the site where some of the holiest scriptures are kept.\n\nFortunately you have arrived in time for the Mahamastakabhisheka ceremony and get to watch as the statue of Bahubali is bathed and anointed and sprinkled with powders of Sandalwood and Vermilion.
It is time I proceed to the temples and mathas of this place.
Girnar

You have arrived in the temple district of Taleti at the foot of Girnar. A long set of stairs will take you up the sacred mountain to see the shrines and temples. It was here that Krishna was once confined by his mother and where he tricked Kalayavana to meet the inflaming ire of the sleeping Muchukunda.\n\nAs you reach the Bhavnat shrine you observe the hundreds of naked Sadhus making their offerings to Shiva and bathing themselves in the tank of the temple. The entire place is resounding with sounds and music and according to some Shiva himself is near.
I must continue my ascent.
Arrival at Shikarji

Having crossed the Madhuban forest, you have finally reached the foot of the Parasnath hills and the pilgrimage of Shikarji. On these mountain peaks 20 out of the 24 tirthankaras achieved moksha through meditation making this one of the holiest of places in the world. Their ascent to Nirvana has left a permanent mark on this place, and during your climb upwards to the sacred peaks you pass the small marble tonks left to commemorate each and every one of them.
It is time to begin my ascent.
Arrival in Mathura.

You have finally arrived at the heart of Braj, in Mathura, the place where lord Krishna was once born. It is said the first temple constructed at this ancient site was built by Vajranabha, the great-grandson of Krishna himself. Since then the devoted have travelled to this place to give their offerings and see this most holy of Hindu places. Today thousands of pilgrims come here, and to the nearby Vrindavan where Krishna spent his youth, every year to circumambulate Govardhana and the other temples.
It is beautiful!
The Eternal City

At the confluence of the Varuna and the Assi lies one of the oldest cities of India. Known by names such as Varanasi, Kasi or Banaras this is also one of the holiest places in the world. For thousands of years pilgrims have visited the hundreds of temples and the many ghats that lead into the holy river Ganges. They have sought enlightenment and purification or in some cases, to die in this place where salvation is guaranteed.\n\nEager to perform your own cleansing you approach the Dashashwamedh Ghats, a set of stairs said to have been created to welcome Shiva by lord Brahma millennia ago, you reflect on Ganges, Krishna and the cycle of rebirth.
I believe it is time for a bath!

This place is invigorating to the mind. Being able to engage with so many great minds of religion and theology has stimulated my understanding and willingness to explore the finer points of the faith. Hours and even days are lost in conversation with Sadhus, Priests and Monks about the deeper meaning of various passages in [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].
The study of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] will be my foremost priority from now on.
Enlightenment can only be achieved through Meditation.

Purification and Enlightenment have never before felt as tangible as in this place. Pilgrims are circumambulating shrines, sadhus are conveying their blessings upon the faithful and monks and gurus meditate together. I join those in worship that for thousands of years have attended this place and others like it. This is a profound experience unlike anything I have ever felt before.
I cannot wait to tell others about this!

Many pilgrims have stories of the experiences from their journeys and the great enlightenment or purification achieved in at the destination. I expected much more than I have found here. The place is certainly full of monks, sadhus, priests and holy men but neither circumambulation, meditation or cleansing has left me with anything but an empty feeling of doubt.
What is my purpose here?

Eager to engage other in discussion I rushed right ahead to the centers of learning. I can tell the ideas and thoughts I have had over the years have made an impression on others here. Even great minds, scholars and sadhus alike seem taken by my reasoning and my home-grown theological arguments.
It is but a small contribution to the knowledge of mankind.

There are people here from every corner of the world. Though we are united in reverence of this holy place their languages, clothes and even the people themselves seem exotic and different. Meeting and conversing with strangers is in itself an experience that will impact me more than the religious aspects of this pilgrimage itself.
I must talk to them all!
I must observe and learn about the peoples of this world.

A pilgrimage can be undertaken for many reasons. For some it is a way to atone for past sins, for others a way to repay the universe for what they have. To many the pilgrimage is a great and rejuvenating journey. I feel convinced this is so, for my journey has left me invigorated in a way I have never experienced before.
Perhaps the time has come to begin the journey home?

Like me many others have come here to seek the spiritual experience of their life. To some this is draining but I find it to be quite invigorating. With the appetite of the mind sated perhaps it is time to enjoy myself?
Yes, why not?
I must exercise control of the body as well as the mind.
Healer?

A holy place such as this has always attracted mystics, sadhus and yogis. After completing my cleansing bath in the Ganges and started to climb back up the ghats I met an old wrinkled man who bestowed his blessing upon me. Ever since I have felt more powerful and invigorated.

A holy place such as this has always attracted mystics, sadhus and yogis. Knowing that their blessings are said to have great power I could not help but seek out one who is said to have a way to heal the sick. I spent some time with this man and ate and drank a variety of things according to his instructions. For the most part it is hard to remember what happened but it appears I slept for several days before leaving him with a feeling of invigoration I have not felt for a long time.
I have been healed by a higher power!
This man was truly a great healer.
I must learn more about this mystery!

Surrounded by pilgrims, temples and shrines it is hard not to be taken aback by the great faith of the masses. Their reverence really is quite endearing. Should I reveal my true identity to them and receive their open adoration and worship? What better place to do this than here, a destination they have all sought out to experience my favor...
Let them see me for who I truly am!
They could not bear to receive me in full glory, for now I must spare them.

Enrichment of the spirit is all well and good but perhaps it is now time to see what the temporal world has to offer. Surely there is both food, good company and good drink to be had nearby? Now that I am here I must sate my appetite for the local delicacies.
Let us see what this place truly has to offer...
I must strive to overcome the crass demands of flesh and bone.

The adoration I thought I saw was clearly nothing but blind stupidity! These pilgrims are fools and do not know the full extent of my power. The lucky ones may never find out but those that ejected me from the temple grounds will curse this day.
They do not realize what they have awoken...

I am home at last after my journey. I have learnt new things, experienced the greatness of the faith and met with interesting people. While it is good to be home I am confident that I will always remember this trip very fondly.
A great experience!
I am home at last after a long journey. While it is said that a pilgrimage can rejuvenate the soul and body I cannot claim it did for me. On the whole this has been a most disappointing experience.
My home is my castle.

I am finally home after a long and tiring journey. Though the insolent rats did not recognize me or pay proper homage, it was still an enlightening experience. Now there is plenty of time to prepare their day of reckoning.
They will pay for their shortsightedness.
Pilgrim
The character has completed a great pilgrimage.
Go on Pilgrimage
Go on a Pilgrimage to one of the holy places of India.

You must perform a holy pilgrimage to atone for your sins and to reflect upon the greatness of God. This spiritual journey will help you reflect upon yourself and increase your standing with the order.
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Go on a Pilgrimage'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully complete a pilgrimage to one of the holy cities of Christianity.
Go on a Pilgrimage
You must perform a holy pilgrimage to cleanse yourself and to strive to enlightenment.
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Go on Pilgrimage'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully complete a pilgrimage to one a holy site.

It was the journey of a lifetime.

A disciple of [Root.GetDWDevil] will soon appear at the court of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n

Finally, my devout servant has arrived. [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetBestName] is a most accomplished [From.GetDWMagician] and well-versed in the hallowed secrets of [From.GetDWDarkMagic]. With [From.GetHerHim] at my side, I shall continue to carry out the work of the great [Root.GetDWDevil].
Welcome to my court, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
Invite Disciple of [Root.GetDWDevil]
As the [Root.GetSocietyRank] of [Root.Society.GetName], §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can invite a disciple of [Root.GetDWDevil] to join [Root.GetHerHis] court.
Praised be [Root.GetMOGod]!
I will double my efforts from now on!

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. While I was skeptical at first, I have found much truth in the words of [Root.GetMOSaint]. This is truly a path worth treading. I am a doubter no more.
My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. As I have followed this holy path, I have reigned in my bodily desires for food and other physical excesses.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. As I have followed this holy path, I have felt my need for material goods diminish. I no longer crave excess and indulgences.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Following in the footsteps of [Root.GetMOSaint] has motivated me to be more active and spend my time on matters of greater importance than naps and games.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. As I have striven to be more like [Root.GetMOSaint] I have also realized that I rarely envy the fortune of others anymore.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. I used to get angered by the smallest things, but lately I have striven to be more like [Root.GetMOSaint] and nowadays I barely notice that which used to annoy me.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. In my attempts to become more like [Root.GetMOSaint], I have striven to think less of myself and more of others. The sense of pride which once shackled me is gone.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Once, I used lies and deceit to get out of trouble and fulfill my desires. Following the path of [Root.GetMOSaint] has taught me better.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Studying the works and life of [Root.GetMOSaint] has made me realize the error of my ways. I have promised myself to treat others with less ire and more compassion.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. My attempts to follow in the footsteps of [Root.GetMOSaint] has led me to realize the sinful nature of my lusts. I will try to see people for who they are, and not simply objects of my desire, from now on.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. As I have followed this holy path, I have noticed that my sense of ego and need for recognition has all but vanished. This change has helped me focus on the things which really matter.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Since I joined [Root.Society.GetName] I have practiced charity, yet it was not until today I realized I was truly glad to let go of my personal possessions. Helping those in need is truly fulfilling.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Abstaining from my bodily desires has allowed me to connect with people on a much deeper level. I also find that my mind is clearer and more peaceful than it has ever been before.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. Following in the footsteps of [Root.GetMOSaint], I have realized the value of kindness. Every display of compassion brings us closer to a purer, gentler and holier world.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. In my quest to live like [Root.GetMOSaint] I have avoided indulgences and impulsive actions. Each time I have been tested, my self-control has grown, and now I resist most desires with an ease I have never experienced previously.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. On this holy path I have discovered the value of being true, to myself as well as others. Once I would lie to hide my sin and shame, however, I no longer feel I have anything to hide.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. It took time and effort, but finally studying the life of [Root.GetMOSaint] has shown me the error of my ways. I will no longer strive to obtain personal glory – I live to serve [Root.Society.GetName].

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. By following this holy path I have shed my material and prideful desires, one by one. Now I am truly content with my place in this world and no longer crave more.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. By studying the life of [Root.GetMOSaint], I have found the value of patience and acceptance. This realization has granted me the peace of mind I never thought I would have.

My wish to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson] has led me to [Root.GetMOCode]. I no longer feel the need to serve my own desires – I would much rather labor to make this world a better place for everyone in it. In my work I have found a true connection to the divine.
Doing Penance
This character has secluded themselves to contemplate their sins and deepen their connection to God.
In Meditation
dealing with vice successfully.\n
failing to deal with vice.\n
overcoming the vice fully.\n
failing terribly to overcome the vice.\n
This character has secluded themselves to meditate on the truths of their life and the universe.

During my time [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation] I have spent many long hours contemplating my carnal desires. Despite my attempts to stay true to [Root.GetMOCode], I can never seem to restrict myself around [Root.GetMenWomenPreference]! As I sit here in solitude, ignoring that relentless heat in the pit of my stomach is getting harder and harder...
If I find a [Root.GetManWomanPreference] to quench my lust with, I can focus afterwards.
I swear, I will not lie with a [Root.GetManWomanPreference] for at least three years!
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! makes some progress [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation].

I waited until midnight before I left my chambers and hurried towards the quarters of [holy_seclusion_lover.GetTitledFirstName]. [holy_seclusion_lover.GetSheHeCap] greeted me with the sweetest of smiles and in [holy_seclusion_lover.GetHerHis] arms, all of my wishes were fulfilled. When I returned to my chambers some hours later, the [Root.Location.GetHolding] was still deserted.

I waited until midnight before I left my chambers and hurried towards the servants' quarters. There I found a [Root.GetManWomanPreference] with the sweetest of smiles that told me all of my wishes would be fulfilled. When I returned to my chambers some hours later, the [Root.Location.GetHolding] was still deserted.
Now I can focus again!
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! makes no progress [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation].\n

I waited until midnight before I left my seclusion and ventured out in the [Root.Location.GetHolding] to find a willing lover. I visited the chambers of the [Root.GetMenWomenPreference] I had shared a bed with before, but all of them were either asleep or uninterested. As morning approached I returned to my lonely bed, where I spent some time with a fantasy before drifting off to sleep...
Well, that was a futile effort.

At first, every day I went without a [Root.GetManWomanPreference]'s touch felt like torture. At night it was all I dreamed about and during the day I could hardly think about anything else. But then, somehow, it got easier. I became more comfortable in my solitude and adhering to [Root.GetMOCode] does not feel as impossible as it once did.
Now, I know my own strength. Mind over body.
Promise of Celibacy
This character has promised to remain celibate for three years.
Rampant Sinner
This character simply cannot help but act shamefully. Even as they attempted to do penance, they fell to sin.
Rampant Sinner
This character simply cannot help but act shamefully. Even as they secluded themselves to meditate, they fell to sin.

I tried to ignore the thoughts, but it was impossible! In the end, I could not take it anymore, and snuck out one evening to visit the local brothel. Afterwards, I returned to my chambers, thinking that was the end of it. However, it turns out that someone saw me, and now everyone knows!
I must learn to control this!

I know that [Root.GetMOSaint] was a paragon of temperance, however I struggle to control my appetite. While [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation], I am supposed to eat very simple food in small portions, but I am growing weary. I cannot concentrate when my stomach rumbles like this!
After a little treat I shall return to my duties with doubled focus!
I shall defeat my desires with a fast!

I waited until midnight before I made my way to the kitchens. I found some of my favorite treats in one of the pantries. After many days on the most dreary of diets, they tasted like the most delicious food I had ever eaten! My appetite is satiated for now and no one is the wiser.
That was exactly what I needed.

After midnight I ventured to the kitchens to find something to still my hunger. I quickly found my favorite treats and proceeded to shove handfuls into my mouth. However, my binge was interrupted as a servant entered the room. As I hid in the pantry, the shame washed over me, and I could not eat anything else.
Now I just feel nauseated...

During the first days of my fast, I felt as if I was going to die. As I woke on the third day, however, I was surprised by how clear my mind was and how little the lack of sustenance bothered me. The next day when I broke my fast and returned to my simple diet, it was more than enough to satisfy me.
I am stronger than I thought.

The first day of the fast went reasonably well, but on the second one, I woke up ravenous. I thought I would die! I hurried to the kitchen, ignoring the servants' stares. Once there I proceeded to shove anything edible I could find into my mouth, not caring who saw me. Now everyone knows about my failure!
How could I shame myself so?

My [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] always talks about the importance of charity, and I do give alms to the poor on a regular basis. However, I often feel reluctant when doing so, and it brings me shame. While [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation], I have had plenty of time to think about this. Perhaps I should strive to be more charitable?
I still give, don't I? Surely that must be enough.
I don't give enough. I will make another donation!

After coming to the realization that I am already doing so much for my subjects as their [Root.GetTitle], I have been able to put the thought about charity out of my mind. It does not distract me any longer.
I am a good [Root.GetReligiousPerson], on the whole.

I thought I was happy with my decision, but then the guilt came creeping. I should not crave money and possessions in this way. These feelings are not in accordance with [Root.GetMOCode], but I cannot help myself.
I am a good [Root.GetReligiousPerson], am I not? Surely?

I ordered one of my most trusted servants to take a substantial sum of money from my personal treasury and bring it to the local [Root.GetMOBuilding]. Strangely enough, when [Root.GetSheHe] left, I felt... relief. Perhaps this is the first step towards freeing myself of the desire for material possessions?
The money will come to good use, I am sure.

I ordered one of my most trusted servants to take a substantial sum of money from my personal treasury and bring it to the local [Root.GetMOBuilding]. However, as soon as [Root.GetSheHe] left the room, a feeling of overwhelming unease came over me, and I could not focus on my prayers. The feeling kept growing by the minute and when my servant returned I immediately demanded that [Root.GetSheHe] would go and get the money back. Now everyone knows about my greed!
I wish I wouldn't have acted so rashly...

For a true follower of [Root.GetMOCode], the importance of saying [Root.GetPrayers] and studying [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] – at least my [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] says so. However, while [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation] for days on end, I struggle to stay focused. Sometimes I feel that I am just sitting here, doing nothing. If I closed my eyes for just a moment... surely that would not be so bad?
A little nap would do me good.
If I am getting tired, I must double my efforts!

I was so immensely bored by my [Root.GetPrayers] and [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], but after a little nap my duties did not feel quite so impossible anymore. I cannot expect myself to become like [Root.GetMOSaint] overnight. One step at a time, I say!
That was wise of me.

Waking up was an unpleasant experience, to say the least. I had sunk to the floor and also managed to get drool all over the chest of my garb. When I sluggishly pushed myself back to seated, I was aghast to realize that the room was pitch black! It was in the middle of the night and every single candle had burned out.
It was only supposed to be a little nap!

During the first hours every minute felt like an eternity, but then it got easier. My weariness was as good as gone and a certain passage of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] grabbed my interest. I kept reading, consumed by the powerful words, and suddenly it was morning! I went to sleep with a smile upon my lips and a renewed sense of purpose.
Self-control is far greater a reward than indulgence.

I do not remember falling asleep, but suddenly I realized I was sprawled across the floor. Apparently I had crashed on top of my copy of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], because once I struggled to my feet I noticed that its pages were torn and that I had ink smeared across my face. No matter how hard I tried, I could not wash it off. Surely my servants are gossiping about my failure, and soon everyone will know!
What an embarrassment!
Through perseverance and concentration you have managed to defeat your sinful nature and maintain seclusion.
You have been betrayed by your sinful nature and broken seclusion for a time. This has shamed you in the eyes of others and greatly hampered your progress.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! struggles while [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation].\n
Adherent
Companion
Propagandist
Grand Mistress
Propagandist
The Grand Master will get in contact with §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! about the loan.\n

For me, the biggest challenge while [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation] is the solitude. As I sit here and reflect upon [Root.GetMOCode], thoughts enter my mind which I desperately want to share with someone, but I have barely exchanged a single word since I began my seclusion. I glance out of my window only to see [potential_friend.GetTitledFirstName] engaged in a lively conversation with some friends.
I will go down there and join them, if only for a few minutes!
I should stay here, alone with my thoughts.

While [potential_friend.GetTitledFirstName] and [potential_friend.GetHerHis] friends were surprised to see me, they were excellent company! As I stood there, surrounded by people, I could not stop talking. What was supposed to be a few minutes turned into an hour before my companions had to excuse themselves and get back to their duties.
That was nice, although I know I shouldn't have.

This is the challenge I have been given, and I will not give up so quickly. I returned to my copy of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and continued where I had left off. During the first few pages, thoughts about the jolly friends in the courtyard kept distracting me, but after a while I found peace in my reading.
Being alone is not so bad, after all.

I left the window and returned to my copy of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and continued where I had left off. However, my heart was not really in it, and thoughts about the jolly friends in the courtyard kept distracting me. Then my thoughts drifted to my own companions, and how they had made no attempts to get in touch for weeks...
How did [Root.GetMOSaint] cope with this loneliness?

I cannot make sense of this passage of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]! The words are archaic and their meaning is deeply hidden by copious layers of symbolism. It would greatly benefit my spiritual development if I discovered the text's essence on my own, although at this point, perhaps I would be better of asking my [court_spiritual.GetJobTitle].
I will figure this out on my own.
There is no shame in asking for help.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! interprets the passage successfully, a testament to [Root.GetHerHis] great understanding of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! fails to make sense of the passage.\n
§Y[court_spiritual.GetTitledName]§! manages to explain the passage to §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
§Y[court_spiritual.GetTitledName]§! is unhelpful and §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! fails to make sense of the passage.\n
Ignorant

A true follower of [Root.GetMOCode] does not give up easily. I kept at it, reading the passage again and again, compared it with other holy texts and mulled over the wording for hours at end. It went slowly, but every now and then I uncovered a new piece of the puzzle, and suddenly, I saw it! Such elegance, such depth! I will carry this revelation with me until the day I die.
The wisdom of [Root.GetMOGod] is infinite and indisputable.
The wisdom of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is infinite and indisputable.

In my obstinacy, I refused to ask for help. Surely I, the [Root.GetTitle], would know enough of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] to understand the meaning of this passage! Hour upon hour I sat staring at the words, trying to make sense of them, but each interpretation I could think of felt lackluster and hollow...
The wisdom of [Root.GetMOGod] is beyond my understanding.
The wisdom of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is beyond my understanding.

Being proud is not in accordance with [Root.GetMOCode], so I decided to ask [court_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [court_spiritual.GetFirstName] for help. [court_spiritual.GetSheHeCap] was happily surprised by my request and together we proceeded to unravel the wordings of the passage. With [court_spiritual.GetFirstName]'s patient guidance, I managed to make sense of it at the end!

I immediately sought out [court_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [court_spiritual.GetFirstName] to request [court_spiritual.GetHerHis] aid. I seemed to have caught [court_spiritual.GetHerHim] at a bad time, however, for [court_spiritual.GetSheHe] agreed with some discernible reluctance. [court_spiritual.GetFirstName] had no patience with me and when I failed to keep up, I left in anger!
[court_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [court_spiritual.GetFirstName] is the ignorant one!
Kind Parent

I am bent over [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], trying to make sense of an especially cryptic passage, when a faint tap on the door breaks my concentration. I call for my visitor to enter. To my surprise, little [interrupting_child.GetFirstName]'s [interrupting_child.GetFaceDescription] face peaks through the opening. "[Root.GetFatherMotherCap], why are you hiding? I miss you!"
Come here, [interrupting_child.GetDaughterSon], and we shall read [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].

§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! teaches §Y[interrupting_child.GetTitledFirstName]§! an important lesson from [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], thus doing a valuable deed according to [Root.GetMOCode].\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! fails to teach §Y[interrupting_child.GetTitledFirstName]§!, thus wasting time which could have been spent contemplating [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].\n
I am sorry, my [GetRootFromCompliment]. Come and sit on my lap.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! takes some time to comfort [Root.GetHerHis] child, delaying [Root.GetHerHis] progress somewhat.\n
I do not have time right now, [interrupting_child.GetFirstName].
§Y[interrupting_child.GetTitledFirstName]§! understands and §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can go back to [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is insensitive and hurts §Y[interrupting_child.GetTitledFirstName]§!, thus harming [Root.GetHerHis] progress [Root.GetMOPenanceMeditation].\n

[interrupting_child.GetFirstName] listened attentively as I read from [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. After I was done, [interrupting_child.GetSheHe] had many questions which we discussed thoroughly. While [interrupting_child.GetFirstName] is still too young to grasp the finer nuances, I do think [interrupting_child.GetSheHe] learned something important. Helping my [interrupting_child.GetDaughterSon] is truly rewarding.
I am proud of you, my [interrupting_child.GetDaughterSon]!
Cruel Parent

I read one of my favorite passages from [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] to [interrupting_child.GetFirstName], although I could quickly tell [interrupting_child.GetSheHe] had no interest in the holy words. I then failed to engage my [interrupting_child.GetDaughterSon] in a conversation about the passage, so I considered myself defeated and sent [interrupting_child.GetHerHim] on [interrupting_child.GetHerHis] way.
My [interrupting_child.GetDaughterSon] has... other qualities.

I patiently explained to [interrupting_child.GetFirstName] that I was preoccupied with holy duties, and that I would return to court once they were finished. [interrupting_child.GetSheHeCap] did not understand the importance of my seclusion, most likely, although my gentle words made sure [interrupting_child.GetSheHe] was not hurt.
I shall return to [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].

I am preoccupied with my holy studies, [interrupting_child.GetFirstName], and I want no distractions! Go and find your [other_parent.GetFatherMother] and leave me to [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]! For an uncomfortably long moment, [interrupting_child.GetFirstName] just stared at me. Then, with a loud sob, [interrupting_child.GetSheHe] turned around and ran, leaving the door ajar.
That came out wrong...

[Root.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]

The hectic life of a ruler rarely allows for sufficient time for contemplation. I ask of you to seclude yourself and think about your life and your actions – a sort of penance for your sins.

[Root.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]

The hectic life of a ruler rarely allows for sufficient time for contemplation. I ask of you to seclude yourself and think about the universe and your place in it. Awareness is the first step to freedom, [Root.GetSocietyRank].

[Root.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

Today, my seclusion begins. I have selected a simple chamber in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding] where I will spend most of my time during the coming months. Within those bare walls, I shall do my [Root.GetPrayers], read [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and contemplate my life and actions.
[Root.GetMOGod] shall be my companion.
In solitude there is peace.
Do Penance
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can seclude [Root.GetHerselfHimself] and contemplate their life and sins in order to become a better [Root.GetReligiousPerson].
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has not secluded [Root.GetHerselfHimself] to do penance recently.\n
Begin Secluded Meditation
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can seclude [Root.GetHerselfHimself] and meditate upon their life and the universe to move closer towards spiritual enlightenment.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has not secluded [Root.GetHerselfHimself] to meditate recently.\n

I have spent the entire day saying [Root.GetPrayers] in deep concentration. During the first hours I noticed nothing out of the ordinary, although at some point I lost track of time and entered a dreamlike state. There was nothing but the holy words passing through my lips, and they rang true as the sweetest music.

There is a bountiful well of wisdom in [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. Today, I have uncovered new meanings in several passages which I have previously never given much thought. I shall take these lessons to heart and carry them with me, no matter where life takes me. Mark my words, [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is truly is a book of wonders!

Today has been a day of new insights and revelations. In my seclusion I have had plenty of time to think about my actions, my life and my place in this world. Things I had never thought about before suddenly became so clear.
[Root.GetMOGod] has shown me the light!
Today my awareness has truly expended.

[Root.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]
We are pleased with your progress. During the time you spent in contemplative seclusion you have taken a great step on the path of [Root.GetMOCode]. Hereby I declare your mission completed.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName].
You honor me, [From.GetSocietyRank]

To [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]
I have heard some disturbing tales regarding your time in holy seclusion, [Root.GetSocietyRank]. I fear that you are not yet ready for the contemplation I expected of you. We will revisit this mission at a later date, but for the time being, I must consider this a failure.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I have failed you, [From.GetSocietyRank].
[Root.holy_seclusion_points.GetName]: [Root.holy_seclusion_points.GetValue]

[Root.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]
You have impressed us all with your noble rule and adherence to [Root.GetMOCode]. As a reward for your recent advancement to the rank of [Root.GetSocietyRank], I have sent you one of [Root.GetMOSaint]'s finger bones. Protect this holy relic with your life.

Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Saint's Fingerbone
This little bone is said to have come from a great saint.
Muni
This man has taken the Mahavrata vows and lives a life of asceticism, thus making him unable to marry or inherit.
Aryika
This woman has taken the Mahavrata vows and lives a life of asceticism, thus making her unable to marry or inherit.
Bhikkhu
This man lives a life of asceticism in accordance with the Patimokkha rules, thus making him unable to marry or inherit.
Bhikkuni
This woman lives a life of asceticism in accordance with the Patimokkha rules, thus making her unable to marry or inherit.
Sanyasi
This man has chosen a life of simplicity and celibacy, thus making him unable to marry or inherit.
Sanyasini
This woman has chosen a life of simplicity and celibacy, thus making her unable to marry or inherit.
Has §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§! greater or equal to [Root.GetSocietyRankUpTooltip1][Root.GetSocietyRankUpTooltip2]
Thief
Useless Moron

My [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle], [rumor_councillor.GetTitledFirstName], has brought me the most extraordinary news! Apparently [rumor_councillor.GetSheHe] has uncovered a rumor concerning an exceedingly special artifact. The specifics of [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]'s information are uncertain, but [rumor_councillor.GetSheHe] is convinced that there is a degree of truth to the tales.
Start the search at once, [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle]!
§Y[rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]§! immediately begins to search for the extraordinary artifact.\n
Excellent! You have my thanks, [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can ask one of [Root.GetHerHis] councillors to search for the extraordinary artifact.\n
Rumor of Extraordinary Artifact
This character has been reach by a rumor of an extraordinary artifact! They can send one of their councillors to search for it.

After the council meeting, [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName] asked me to exchange a few words in private. Apparently [rumor_councillor.GetSheHe] has uncovered a rumor concerning a rare artifact. [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName] believed there was some truth to the rumor and urged me to have a search arranged.
A good idea, [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle]. You should arrange it.
§Y[rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]§! immediately begins to search for the rare artifact.\n
You have my thanks, [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]!
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can ask one of [Root.GetHerHis] councillors to search for the rare artifact.\n
Rumor of Rare Artifact
This character has been reached by a rumor of a rare artifact! They can send one of their councillors to search for it.

During this evening's council meeting, [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName] told us of a rumor [rumor_councillor.GetSheHe] had encountered. The peasants speak of an artifact hidden not far away from here. The specifics of [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]'s information are uncertain, but perhaps this would be worth investigating.
[rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName], arrange a search.
§Y[rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]§! immediately begins to search for the artifact.\n
Interesting...
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can ask one of [Root.GetHerHis] councillors to search for the artifact.\n
Rumor of Artifact
This character heard a rumor concerning an artifact. They can send one of their councillors to search for it.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] approached me after the council meeting to request some more diplomats to aid [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] in obtaining more information concerning the rumored artifact. While I could divert some of my envoys to this task for a time, our regular diplomatic efforts would suffer due to the neglect.
You shall have your diplomats, [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle].
§Y[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]§! makes significant progress in the search for the rumored artifact.\n
I cannot spare these important resources.
§Y[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]§! struggles in the search for the rumored artifact.\n

The hunt for the rumored artifact has begun to slow down, [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] just informed me. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has some valuable and promising leads, but to investigate them the search must venture into distant, inhospitable lands. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] claims [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] needs more soldiers to attempt such a venture.
We cannot miss this opportunity.
Occupied Diplomats
The court diplomats of this ruler are occupied with a special project and general diplomatic efforts are suffering as a consequence.
Adventuring Soldiers
A large number of this character's soldiers are occupied with a mission in distant lands.

My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has sought me out with [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] concerns regarding the search for the relic. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has asked me to issue a decree allowing [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] treasure hunters to appropriate the resources and men they need from the local burghers.
You shall have your decree, [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle].
I cannot provoke my subjects in such a way.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has uncovered several clues indicating that [spy_target.GetTitledFirstName] of [spy_title.GetName] possesses important information regarding the rumored artifact. However, [spy_target.GetSheHe] is unwilling to talk and [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] wants more spies transferring from their regular missions to target the [spy_target.GetTitle] instead.
The artifact is of great importance. The spies are yours.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has spent many weeks bent over ancient tomes and scrolls in search of more information regarding the rumored artifact. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] claims to be on the right path but apparently the progress is slow. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has asked of me to order the best scholars in [primary_title.GetName] to aid [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] efforts.
The brightest minds shall be at your disposal.
Decree of Appropriation
This character has made a decree allowing their treasure hunters to appropriate any resources required from the local burghers.
Occupied Spies
This character has had a large number of their spies diverted from their current missions to investigate rumors of a lost artifact.
Occupied Scholars
This character has ordered the brightest minds in their demesne to aid an investigation concerning a lost artifact.

Despite the monthly sum of gold I have set aside for the artifact investigation, [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] claims that [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] lacks the sufficient funds. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has asked me to put an additional sum to [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] disposal.
I understand, [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle]. You shall have the money.
'Lacks the sufficient funds'? What a wastrel!
§Y[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]§! is given no additional money.\n

One of my spies has brought me some disturbing news. Apparently [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has been putting the extra funds I gave [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] own pocket!
I never should have trusted that light-fingered traitor!
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! reveals the crime of §Y[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]§! and is allowed to imprison [relic_hunter.GetHerHim].\n
I shall show mercy but demand doubled efforts.
§Y[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]§! is thankful and works harder from now on, speeding up the search a little.

For some time now, I have been worried about [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]'s progress, or rather, the lack thereof. Now my worst fears have been confirmed. As a consequence of [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]'s carelessness, an accident has occurred and a large amount of the resources and documentation was ruined!
Why did I entrust the search to that [GetRootFromInsult]?!
There is a big setback in the search for the rumored artifact.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has shared an intriguing discovery with me. During [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search for the artifact, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] has come across the rumors of an even rarer object! If we decide to pursue this new lead instead we can still make use of some of the old research and resources, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] tells me.
How exciting! We shall investigate the new lead instead.
The original investigation ends, but some of the progress will still be helpful in the new search.\n
The risks are too great. We stay on the original path.
Search for Artifact

Because §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has heard of the rumors of a lost artifact [From.GetSheHe] can order [From.GetHerHis] [Root.GetJobTitle], §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, to arrange a search for it.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a councilor of §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! arranges a search for the rumored artifact.\n
The previous artifact hunter is replaced.\n
Some of the previously made progress is lost.\n
End Search for Artifact
Ask §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! to stop searching for the rumored artifact.
The search for the artifact is ended. A new councilor can be appointed to lead the search as long as the rumor is still viable.
[Root.relic_score.GetValue]
Paying for Artifact Search
This character is paying one of their councilors to search for a rumored artifact.
Paying for Artifact Search
This character is paying one of their councilors to search for artifacts.
Paying for Artifact Search
This character is paying one of their councilors to search for artifacts.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] came to me with some regrettable news. It seems like the too much has passed since we first uncovered the rumor of the artifact and now the trail has gone cold. There is no hope of finding the lost treasure and the search has been canceled.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] can no longer fulfill [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] duty to search for the rumored artifact. I can select another councilor to replace [relic_hunter.GetHerHim].

[Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] must have cast a curse on me and my venture to recover the lost artifact, for I was just brought the most dreadful news! [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] died in an unexplainable accident while searching for the artifact.
[relic_hunter.GetFirstName] is with [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] now.

The names of some Assassins will live on forever. These extraordinary [Root.GetMenWomen] spent their entire lives studying and practicing the arts of an Assassin – disguise, infiltration, combat, and war strategies, as well as the customs and languages of their enemies. Finding and training the shining star of the next generation is a duty which has fallen upon you.

To complete this mission, the training of a protégé must be initiated and completed. §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will search for a suitable candidate. When one has been located, an event will appear.
Assassinate [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]

The Assassins prefer to intimidate their enemies into submission, but a threat is not threatening without any actual weight behind it. Therefore the Order assassinate their biggest enemies publicly to strike fear in the hearts of anyone who dare oppose them. Your mission is to assassinate §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, a punishment for [FromFrom.GetHerHis] crimes against the Order and the True Faith.

To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must successfully complete a murder plot against [Root.GetHerHis] target, §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!. To initiate the plot, select the diplomatic action §Y'Plot to Kill'§! by right-clicking on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
Convert [FromFrom.GetName] to Shi'ism

The most essential goals of the Assassins is to protect the believers of the True Faith and spread the words of Allah, Muhammad and Ali to every corner of the Earth. While even the most remote lands shall be converted one day, first we must turn to places closer to home. Your mission is to convert the county [FromFrom.GetName] to Shi'ism.
To complete this mission, the religion of the county [FromFrom.GetName] must become Shia. To convert [FromFrom.GetName], send your court Mullah to §Y'Proselytize'§! there.
Collect Debt From [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]

§Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! borrowed a significant amount of gold from the Order. When it was time to pay it back, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] refused. It is your mission to scare §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! to the point where [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will beg the Order to accept [FromFrom.GetHerHis] money.

To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must successfully complete a debt collection plot against [Root.GetHerHis] target, §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!. To initiate the plot, select §Y'Collect Debt from [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'§! in the Intrigue menu.
Occupy [FromFrom.GetName]

To protect the True Faith, the Assassins must sometimes make a preemptive strike against the infidels. You shall attack one of our enemies' key holdings, the [FromFrom.GetHolding] of [FromFrom.GetName] in [FromFrom.Location.County.GetName]. Your mission is completed when the [FromFrom.GetHolding] is under your control.

To complete this mission, declare war on §Y[FromFrom.Holder.Realm.Holder.GetTitledName]§! and siege the holding [FromFrom.GetName] in the county [FromFrom.Location.GetName] until it is under the control of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
Corrupt [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]

The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] are oblivious fools. §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! leads [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sheepish flock down a path which will only bring weakness and stagnation. It is up to you to give [FromFrom.GetHerHim] a new direction.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Corrupt [FromFrom.Religion.GetPriestTitle]'§! and successfully corrupt [FromFrom.GetHerHim].
Desecrate the Temple of [FromFrom.GetName]

The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of the [FromFrom.GetHolding] of [FromFrom.GetName] worship their weak, false [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Tear down their powerless idols, torch their holy books and steal their riches in honor of [Root.GetDWDevil]!
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Start Desecration'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully desecrate the [FromFrom.GetHolding] of §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!.
Sacrifice a Ruler

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of a powerful ruler.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a landed ruler and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.
Sacrifice a Holy Person

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them someone who pledged their life to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] or an ascetic and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.
Sacrifice a Virgin

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of someone who has never known love.

To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a virgin and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!. Children, chaste and ascetic characters are likely virgins.
Sacrifice a Dwarf

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of a dwarf.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a dwarf and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.
Spawn of [Root.GetDWDevil]

The time has come for the embodied spawn of [Root.GetDWDevil] to enter this world and bring about a new era of glorious majesty. This child will lead humankind to a great future where we, the true followers, shall rule empires. The honor of choosing the unholy mother has fallen upon you.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on a woman of child-bearing age in your court and select §Y'Unholy Impregnation'§!.
Demonic Possession

Our almighty [Root.GetDWDevil] needs all sort of servants. For some missions, a true [Root.GetDWMagician] is needed. Other and more menial tasks, however, do not require the same kind of power and wit. Place §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! under your control and have them carry out [Root.GetDWDevil]'s wishes.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Demonic Possession'§! and successfully enthrall [FromFrom.GetHerHim].
Secluded Penance

To bring yourself closer to God and repent for your sins, you are to seclude yourself to do penance. Spend your days reading the Holy Bible, praying to God and contemplating your life and actions. During this time, you must live simply and restrict your access to the outside world.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Do Penance'§! in the Intrigue Menu and successfully complete your holy seclusion.
Secluded Meditation

To bring yourself closer to the divine and the final freedom, you are to seclude yourself to meditate. Spend your days reading [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], saying mantras and contemplating your actions and the universe. During this time, you must live simply and restrict your access to the outside world.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Begin Secluded Meditation'§! in the Intrigue Menu and successfully complete your holy seclusion.
Donate to Charity

An important function of [Root.Society.GetName] is helping those in need. Our ability to perform charity is entirely dependent upon donations from the wealthy. As a powerful ruler you are expected to contribute to this cause.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Donate to Charity'§! and successfully complete your holy seclusion.
Pick the Theology Focus

Even though a member of [Root.Society.GetName] always keeps their spiritual development in mind, no matter where they go and what they do, there is a time in all of our lives where these matters become even more crucial. It is time for you to focus on theology.
To complete this mission, pick the §Y'Theology'§! focus in the Character screen.
Build a [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]

To every member of the [Root.Society.GetName], the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] is like a second home. We come here to study, worship and say our [Root.GetPrayers]. Building a new [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] will offer a safe harbor for the local believers and act as an outpost of the Faith, an outstretched hand to those on the wrong path.
To complete this mission, build a temple holding in a county in your realm.

As a practitioner of [Root.GetDWDarkMagic], §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can summon a familiar of [Root.GetHerHis] choice. This supernatural guardian will grant §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! its powers by increasing [Root.GetHerHis] attributes.
And so, it is done.
Now you can only await the pending birth.

Finally, [From.GetSheHe] is here! As I look down on the [From.GetFaceDescription], brilliant face of my little [From.GetSonDaughter], I truly feel that everything I had to do to bring this moment into existence was worth it. Only time will reveal what powers [From.GetHerHis] [Root.GetDWDemon] blood has granted [From.GetHerHim], but I anticipate great things to come...

Finally, [From.GetSheHe] is here! [unholy_mother.GetTitledFirstName] went into labor last night and early this morning, little [From.GetFirstName] was born. [From.GetSheHeCap] seems strong and healthy. Even though only time can reveal what powers [From.GetHerHis] [Root.GetDWDemon] blood has granted [From.GetHerHim], I anticipate great things to come...
Hail [Root.GetDWDevil]!

Black Khan

The elusive Assassins consider themselves the true followers of Allah, and will do anything to further the advances of Shia Islam and protect their fellow believers. Consisting of loyal warriors as well as competent spies, wielding manipulation and social skills as expertly as a dagger, they specialize in asymmetrical warfare, striking hard at the heart of their enemies.

Highly secretive, the covens of the Satanists refuse the doctrine of traditional theologians, finding abstinence from earthly pleasures foolish and dishonest. Praising the Devil, who encourages them to follow their impulses, allows them to instead indulge and follow a path that would outrage any god-fearing man or woman.

The Trollcrafters are a secret fellowship frowned upon by devout pagans, proclaiming Freyja grants them sorcery of old. Some say they are selfish manipulators and schemers, while others are frightened by the rumors surrounding them, such as those of elaborate human sacrifices and unnatural longevity...

The Cult of Kali Purusha worship the demonic aspect of Kali, and refuse the shackles of conventional belief as they see no fault in acts committed out of selfishness. Their spirituality is instead centered around personal gain and lustful endeavors, condemning them in the eyes of traditional believers.

The Plaguebringers worship what traditional believers would call evil spirits, as they curse their enemies with disease and turn to the Erlik, the God of Death, to achieve their personal goals. Most unsettling are the rumors that they carry very little qualms in regards to how this dark favor is gained...

The Cold Ones believe that certain people are born with witch's blood and it is their blessing to be able to turn to Chernobog, the Black God, to gain power and wealth. They are frowned upon by traditional believers, who would rather call them cursed, as they are rumored to sacrifice humans and commit heinous acts in order to achieve their goals.

The Benedictine Order is an old monastic community with 'Ora et Labora', meaning 'pray and labor', as their motto. Often recognized by their black habits, they worship God and find purpose in prayer and quiet contemplation as well as scholarly work.

The Dominican Order are able to listen to the confessions of any Christian – dressed in white and black, they lead the holy inquisition, charged with a mission to identify heretics. As a lay member of their Order you are expected to not pursue material wealth, but strive to be a seeker of truth.

The Community of Saint Basil

The followers of Saint Basil lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.

Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of your prisoners to Sacrifice them to [Root.GetDWDevil], in order to gain §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. Certain prisoners, and mission targets, will please [Root.Society.GetName] more. Be aware that too many Sacrifices may draw attention to your society.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your character's portrait to Summon a Familiar, in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portrait of your spouse in order to annul your marriage, in the name of [Root.GetDWDevil], in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. Your spouse will be no more.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your character's portrait in order to perform a dark ritual to heal yourself, in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.

Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of your children in an attempt to steal their life force, in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of your vassals, courtiers, and rivals, in an attempt to curse them with bad health and disease, in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.

As secret practitioners of our religion we are under constant scrutiny. We ask that you spend some time trying to blend into the religious community of your realm, in order to distract any harmful forces discovering our true beliefs.

[Root.GetSRFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

Eager Believer
This character is currently making an effort to fit into the religious community at court.
Character is in the same society as you are.

Starting today, I shall dedicate myself to convincing the court of my deep devoutness, in the name of the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] faith and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. My allies in [This.Society.GetName] will understand. This is a necessary step if I am to ever convince my people to see the path I, nay, [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] has actually laid out before them. They will thank me later.
I'll make them see.

My advisors inform me that [stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName] has been overheard questioning my loyalty to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. When I summon [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHim], [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] is apologetic, but a raised eyebrow tells of [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] doubt. "It's just a rumor, my [Root.GetLordLady]... You are not overly interested in [Root.GetReligiousRite], but you could surely quote any passage of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] without hesitation...?"
Of course I could, [stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName].
you successfully remembering the perfect line of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and greatly increasing the progress of your mission.\n
you failing to remember a good line of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], causing you to lose some progress.\n
You should not be questioning me. I am your [Root.GetTitle]!
you successfully intimidating §Y[stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName]§! and mildly increasing the progress of your mission.\n
you failing to intimidate §Y[stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName]§!, causing you to lose a lot of your progress.\n
Is there any way I can make you think otherwise, [stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]...?
You slip a pouch of money into [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] hand, slightly slowing the progress of your mission.\n

As I began reciting [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], [stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName]'s eyes widened. I intentionally focused on what I believed to be [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] favorite passage, speaking clearly to [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] interests as a [stubborn_courtier.GetEducationRole]. My gambit seems to have paid off because the deep bow [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] bestowed upon me was nothing short of embarrassment and an eagerness to make up for [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] obvious blunder.
That about do it for you, [stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]?
§Y[stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]§! is humbled and impressed by your words, granting you progress in your mission.\n

As I rack my brain for the appropriate lines to shove triumphantly in [stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName]'s face, my palms grow sweaty.\n"Ezekiel 25:17! I will carry out great vengeance on them..." I begin. Then a slow panic begins to rise within my chest. [stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName] frowns. \n"No, wait, that doesn't seem right. That's not..." I mumble as [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] shakes [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] head and with a roll of [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] eyes walks away, leaving me alone with my failure. By the damnation of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName], how did I get this so wrong?
I've made a fool of myself.
§Y[stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]§! is unimpressed, causing you to lose some progress in your mission.\n

I make it clear to [stubborn_courtier.GetTitledName] that it seems almost heretical for someone supposedly well-versed in [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] to display such a poor understanding of the relationship between a ruler and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].\n[stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName] clearly did not expect to have their own religious understanding challenged, and I try not to smile to myself as [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] sputters an apology. As [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] prepares to leave, I remind [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHim] that many questions can be dangerous to ask.
[stubborn_courtier.GetSheHeCap] understands my veiled threat.
§Y[stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]§! will not spread more rumors, granting you a small progress in your mission.\n

My voice must not have sounded as threatening as I believed it to. When I told [stubborn_courtier.GetTitledFirstName] how it could be dangerous to ask the wrong questions, [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] only laughed. As I followed up with stories of other unfortunate souls who had questioned their liege's faith, [stubborn_courtier.GetHerHis] grin remained. When [stubborn_courtier.GetSheHe] finally departed, it was with an even more disconcerting sentence. "I know exactly where my soul belongs, but I am unsure about yours."
No, wait! I know lines of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]!
§Y[stubborn_courtier.GetFirstName]§! refuses to be intimidated, causing you to lose precious progress in your mission.\n

[Root.GetSRGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]

We are proud to hear of your valiant efforts to remain an undetected member of [This.Society.GetName]. We are honored to count you as one of our own.

[Root.GetSRFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Very well.

[Root.GetSRGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName]

We are sorry to hear of your flimsy efforts to remain a low-key member of [This.Society.GetName]. We had higher hopes than this.

[Root.GetSRFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Curses!

[concerned_friend.GetTitledFirstName] has come to me as a friend, to inquire about my wellbeing. "I feel as though I never see you pray anymore, is something heavy burdening your mind?" [concerned_friend.GetSheHe] asks.\nI think of my true beliefs, and how they need to be kept secret, even of those closest to me.
Oh, I have been having these terrible dreams.
you succeeding significantly.\n
you failing somewhat.\n
I... Everything is fine.
you succeeding somewhat.\n
you failing significantly.\n
Actually, I've been meaning to speak to you about [concerned_friend.GetEducationalTopicPlural].
You distract §Y[concerned_friend.GetTitledFirstName]§! by changing the subject completely, slightly slowing the progress of your mission.\n

I regale [concerned_friend.GetTitledFirstName] with tales of my "dark dreams" of strange and foreign rituals. [concerned_friend.GetSheHeCap] can barely believe the vividness with which I describe the faith of the unbelievers. Afterwards [concerned_friend.GetSheHe] offers me a listening ear for whenever I may be burdened like this again.\nIf only [concerned_friend.GetSheHe] knew.
[concerned_friend.GetFirstName] is a good, loyal and trusting [concerned_friend.GetRootRelation].
§Y[concerned_friend.GetTitledName]§! is moved by your words, granting you progress in your mission.\n

As I describe my "dark dreams," [concerned_friend.GetTitledFirstName]'s expression grows ever more concerned. "You recall these dreams very well," [concerned_friend.GetSheHe] says. "Almost more like memories."\n[concerned_friend.GetFirstName] doesn't comment on it again, but later you worry that you may have made [concerned_friend.GetHerHim] more worried, not less.
I think I gave away too much.
